    §217 riṅ voṅ añjuraṅ ləmah iṅ ləmah, aṅurugi talaga, rava, sivakan, sumur, tan pakon iṅ adr̥ve, ḍəṇḍanən roṅ lakṣa denira saṅ amava bhūmi, kaṅ riku.

    §220 a riṅ pāruṣya ucapən maṅke. riṅ kṣatriya aṅamanuman brāhmaṇa, ḍəṇḍanən saṅ kṣatriya roṅ tali, yen vaiśya aṅuman-uman iṅ saṅ brāhmaṇa, ḍəṇḍanən ikaṅ vaiśya limaṅ tali, vaiśya arane voṅ tani, śūdra aṅuman-uman iṅ saṅ brāhmaṇa, doṣaniṅ ⟨EdJ: 81⟩ śūdra doṣa pati, patyanana riṅ voṅ adagaṅ aṅuman-uman iṅ saṅ brāhmaṇa de saṅ prabhu; saṅ brāhmaṇa yen aṅuman-uman iṅ saṅ kṣatriya, ḍəṇḍanən saṅ brāhmaṇa, (a)ṅuman-uman iṅ voṅ tani, ḍəṇḍanen saṅ brāhmaṇa limaṅ atus, brāhmaṇa aṅuman-uman iṅ voṅ adāgaṅ, saṅ brāhmaṇa ḍəṇḍanən satak save; sak pahayunən manih.

    (404)

    §218 riṅ voṅ amiḍik pomahan, talaga, rava, savah, kali, bəbəṅan, taman, tgal, ḍəṇḍane salakṣa denira saṅ amava bhūmi, yen sakiṅ tan-vruhe, ḍəṇḍane pataṅ tali, kaṅ den-piḍik muliha kadi duk alavas, yen hana bhuktine, tagihən teluṅ pañaraṅ, yen alavas.

    §219 riṅ voṅ kasərəṅən aṅuman-uman iṅ voṅ len aṅavakən malaniṅ avak, aṅavatakən śirah, paṅan, laku, solah, tojanman, kavoṅan, aṅavatakən kagunan, aji, riṅ voṅ maṅkana vākpāruṣya arane.

    §220 b riṅ pāruṣya ucapən maṅke. riṅ kṣatriya aṅuman-uman brāhmaṇa de saṅ prabhu, saṅ brāhmaṇa, yen aṅuman-uman iṅ kṣatriya, ḍəṇḍaniṅ brāhmaṇa sevu, saṅ brāhmaṇa aṅuman-uman voṅ tani, ḍəṇḍanən saṅ brāhma(ṇa) limaṅ atus, brahmaṇa aṅuman-uman iṅ voṅ adagaṅ, saṅ brāhmaṇa ḍəṇḍanən satak save.

    §221 riṅ voṅ aṅuman-uman voṅ paḍa kula-kavoṅane, kaṅ aṅuman-uman ḍəṇḍanən satak salave; maṅkana ajar iṅ śāstra.

    §222 yen saṅ kṣatriya aṅuman-uman iṅ voṅ tani, ḍəṇḍaniṅ saṅ kṣatriya sevu, riṅ voṅ tani aṅuman-uman iṅ bot ⟨da⟩dagaṅ, ḍəṇḍaniṅ voṅ tani sevu, ḍəṇḍaniṅ voṅ tan(i) aṅuman-uman iṅ kṣatriya ḍəṇḍanən ikaṅ voṅ tani roṅ eyu (evu).

    §223 riṅ bot dagaṅ aṅuman-uman iṅ kṣatriya, ḍəṇḍaniṅ bot dagaṅ limaṅ tali, riṅ voṅ tani iṅuman-uman ⟨EdJ: 82⟩ deniṅ bot dagaṅ, ḍəṇḍaniṅ bot dagaṅ roṅ tali.

    §224 riṅ voṅ nīca caṇḍālajanma aṅuman-uman iṅ saṅ brāhmaṇa, riṅ saṅ paṇḍita, patenana kaṅ voṅ nīca cāṇḍāla de saṅ amava bhūmi.

    §225 ḍəṇḍapāruṣya ucapən maṅke. riṅ voṅ amukul, anuduk iṅ kayu, aṅgitikiṅ vatu aṅlarani, aṅəmu gətih, atatuha kunəṅ, anugəlakən, anikəlakən baluṅ, makādi yen amatenana sarvasato, yen voṅ ādine, araniṅ ulah vivijinən, salah tuṅgala ikā ḍəṇḍapāruṣya arane, liṅ saṅ paṇḍita, maṅkana riṅ voṅ amraṅ iṅ sañjata, anuduk ādine, aṅgitik iṅ vatu, riṅ viṅkā, amukul iṅ kayu, riṅ baluṅ, anaṇḍat guluniṅ len iṅ tatali, aniləpakən iṅ bañu, anampel, amərəp, aṅgarut, anəpak, andədəl, aṅgoñoh, aṅgapuk, anahuthamok, amlaciṅ, aṅidoni, aniratra ambal ilu, anampəki kəkəmahan, anampəki ririgən, aṅgutuk iṅ tai, aṅantepakən iṅ tai, anuṇḍuṅakən iṅ tai, riṅ patunan iṅ celeṅ, iku pratyekaniṅ ḍəṇḍapāruṣya.

    (405)(406)

    §226 riṅ bot dagaṅ aṅlarani riṅ brāhmaṇa, asādhana taṅan, suku, caṅkəm, śirah, ḍaḍa, gigir, bāhu, plat, silip iku ta sādhanane pāruṣya riṅ samajanma ləvih kaṅ den-pāruṣyani, siṅ sādhanane aṇḍamalani, tu⟨ṅ⟩gelana de saṅ prabhu, maṅkana liṅ bha(ga)vā(n) manu riṅ śāsana.

    (407)

    §227 riṅ śūdra, makādi riṅ cāṇḍālajati aṅrəṅguk śirah saṅ brāhmaṇa tugəlana taṅane denira saṅ prabhu, yen andədəl iṅ suku, ikaṅ cāṇḍāla śūdra tugəlana sukune denira saṅ prabhu.

    §228 riṅ cāṇḍāla (śūdra) aṅluṅguhi kaluṅguhanira saṅ brāhmaṇa, ikaṅ cāṇḍāla śūdra praṅən vaṅkiṅ-vaṅkiṅnya denira saṅ prabhu.

    §229 yen iṅ śūdra cāṇḍāla aṅuyuhi riṅ saṅ brāhmaṇa ⟨EdJ: 83⟩ ikaṅ cāṇḍāla śūdra tugəlana plate, yen ikaṅ cāṇḍāla śūdra hamivakarpyiṅ, amiji⟨ṅ⟩t iruṅ amumuṇḍak, aṅgutuk iṅ tai, añjəṅkaṅakən, aṅantəpakən iṅ tai, ikaṅ śūdra cāṇḍāla tugəlana taṅane, yen ikaṅ śūdra cāṇḍāla aṅissiṅ(h)i riṅ saṅ brāhmaṇa, duləkən iṅ vsi abaṅ hilihe, yen amləciṅ tugəlana plate lavan taṅane denira saṅ prabhu.

    (408)

    §230 yen hana voṅ pāruṣya akāraṇa kakayu, vatu dene aṅlarani, patikiven makādi ye(n a)ṅlarani voṅ, sasḍəṅniṅ dukhane kaṅ den arani, pinatut lavan guṅ lit iṅ ḍəṇḍa denira saṅ adr̥ve bhūmi amrayogakən ḍəṇḍa, yenora pati alara dene amraṅ, amukul, aṅgatuk den alit ḍəṇḍane limaṅ atus, yen madhyama kanin ḍəṇḍa sevu⟨s⟩, yen uttama kanin (t)əka riṅ baluṅ makādi, yen tikəl, ḍəṇḍa roṅ lakṣa, yen abaṅ kulite emu, aṅəmu gətih, ḍəṇḍa roṅ tali, tur voṅ pāruṣya apatiba jampi, patuku tamba, hiṅana savarase tatu kaṅ (den-)pāruṣyani⟨n⟩.

    §231 riṅ voṅ aṅrəməkakən dr̥veniṅ voṅ, anikəlakən, aṅgəmpalakən, anigarakən, akāraṇa tivase, tan vəruh dene aṅgutuk, amukul, amraṅ dr̥veniṅ para kaṅ rusak ikā, kaṅ kagutuk, kagitik ⟨ikā⟩ kapraṅ (ikā) mulihanikəl piṅro, aṅlenana susukhan riṅ adr̥ve den-muli(h) kayeṅ kuna, maṅkana ḍəṇḍane denira saṅ amava bhūmi, guṅ iṅ ḍəṇḍa den-paḍa lavan əlen-əlen kaṅ rinusakaṅ tikəl.

    §232 riṅ voṅ anuṅgaṅ paḍati, ye(n a)jarana tinuṅgaṅan kunəṅ, sakalviraniṅ tuṅgaṅtinuṅaṅan, aṅgəpok aṅidəki voṅ, yen mati voṅ ikā kaṅ den-gəpok, den-idək ikā, kaṅ anuṅgaṅ yen kaṅ asarathi kunəṅ, ḍəṇḍanən roṅ lakṣa denira saṅ amava bhūmi, tur aveha pamidāra voluṅ tali riṅ kaṅ adr̥ve sovaṅ yen iṅ kadaṅ-varganiṅ mati, gənahaniṅ aveh. ⟨EdJ: 84⟩

    (409)

    §233 yen aṅidək sapi, yen aṅidəki ajaran, yen uṣṭra mati den-idəki ikā, kaṅ asarami ḍəṇḍanən salakṣa vur aṅəlenana sarəgane, samajanane kaṅ mati ikā.

    (410)(411)

    §234 yen alit sāpi kaṅ mati ikā, yen ajarana, yen uṣṭraha ḍəṇḍaniṅ asarathi pataṅ tali, aṅidəki āyam, bebek ikā kaṅ linumbatan, cinaṅcaṅ, ḍəṇḍa limaṅ atus, aṅidəki ayam iṅ bobotoriṅ caṅcaṅan, riṅ kuruṅan, ḍəṇḍa satali.

    §235 aṅidəki⟨ṅ⟩ vḍus vivi, vḍus padu, bañak, ḍəṇḍaniṅ asarathi roṅ tali, yen aṅidəki⟨ṅ⟩ camra, celeṅ ḍəṇḍa patāṅ tali, tur aṅəlenana sapama(ja)n(e) rəgane kaṅ kedəkan ikā.

    §236 riṅ rabi, anak, kavula lanaṅ, kavula vadon, sanakunəṅ, yan śiṣya, saudara ikā arane kabeh yen adoṣa, salah saviji katkana doṣa, təmbaṅən iṅ priṅ savilah, yen tinəmbaṅen iṅ tatali kunəṅ kaṅ tinəmbuṅ gigire, ləṅəne, pupune, bobokoṅe, hayo tinəmbuṅ śirahe, yen tinəmbuṅ śirah aguṅ doṣa salah saviji, dene gənahe adoṣa ḍəṇḍanən roṅ lakṣa denira saṅ amava bhūmi.

    §237 riṅ voṅ añoloṅ ivak iṅ tambak manih yen larane, ḍəṇḍaniṅ añoloṅ voluṅ tali denira saṅ amava bhūmi, yen akeh kaṅ añoloṅ vivijinen amoluṅ tali riṅ voṅ (s)atuṅgal-tuṅgal, tur ivak kaṅ deñ-coloṅ mulihanikəl piṅro, yen vəṅi kāla dene añoloṅ patenana uba doṣane.

    (412)

    §238 riṅ voṅ añoloṅ pari, ləvih sakiṅ sapuluh tənah olihe añoloṅ patenana denira saṅ amava bhūmi, yen sapuluh tənah dene añoloṅ pari tikəlakəna piṅsavlas, ḍəṇḍane mariṅ saṅ amava bhūmi, pari kaṅ den-coloṅ mulihanikəl piṅro mariṅ kaṅ adr̥ve pari cinoloṅ, yen vəṅi māsane añoloṅ patenana uga denira saṅ amava bhūmi. ⟨EdJ: 85⟩

    §239 riṅ voṅ añoloṅ kəmbaṅ, añoloṅ pari yen akəḍik olihe, bobotana, savərate bobote atikəlakəna piṅlavlas, riṅ añoloṅ gaṅan, kuni(r), təmu, gamoṅan, añoloṅ priṅ, añoloṅ odod-ododan, bubuṅkaban, akəḍik olihe añoloṅ, tan mule pañoloṅe, ḍəṇḍanən satak denira saṅ amava bhūmi, tur olihe añoloṅ əka, mulihanikəl mariṅ kaṅ cinoloṅan.

    (413)(414)

    §240 riṅ voṅ añoloṅ mās, manih añoloṅ ratna, yen añoloṅ dodot, yen ləvih sakiṅ haji satus doṣa patiniṅ añoloṅ denira saṅ amava bhūmi, yen ləvih (sakiṅ) haji save, dr̥ve kaṅ de(n)-coloṅ ikā tugəlana taṅane riṅ kaṅ añoloṅ denira saṅ adr̥ve bhūmi, yen dur(u)ṅ sakiṅ haji save kaṅ den-coloṅ ikā, tikəlakəna savlas, samuleniṅ dr̥ve den-coloṅ ikā ḍəṇḍanə(n) denira saṅ amava bhūmi, tur olihe añoloṅ kikelakna piṅro mariṅ taṅ adr̥ve⟨ne⟩ kaṅ cinoloṅan.

    (415)(416)

    §241 riṅ voṅ auoloṅ sajəṅ riṅ umah, añoloṅ skul añoloṅ kəklan, añoloṅ ivak mtah rateṅ añoloṅ manuk⟨a⟩, añoloṅ miñak, añoloṅ lṅa, añoloṅ madhu, pdan, ma⟨h⟩lam, pulut, ⟨tut⟩, gagaraṅan, kuvuk, laṇḍak, yen haneṅ umah den-coloṅ, akāraṇa harəpe riṅ iya, manih añoloṅ anam-anaman .. makādi raga, kicir, yen lagi riṅ umah, añoloṅ guci, piṅgan sakeh iṅ vavaḍah vigil pa .. n, kəṇḍi kunəṅ, añoloṅ uyah, tarasi asəs prak, jruk, sahananiṅ raragi haneṅ umah manih añoloṅ bhasmara avu, arəṅ ikā, kaṅ den-coloṅ salah tuṅgala, makādi bras riṅ pasimpənan den-coloṅ, kaṅ añoloṅ, ḍəṇḍanən samulane rəgane kaṅ den-coloṅ ikā tikəlakəna pi(ṅ)ṇḍo, tur kaṅ den-coloṅ mulihanikəl mariṅ kaṅ adr̥ve, ḍəṇḍa anikəl piṅro sarəgane mariṅ saṅ amava bhūmi.

    (417)(418)(419)

    §242 riṅ voṅ aṅivat voṅ ṅahabika voṅ vadon ⟨EdJ: 86⟩ ləvih, añoloṅ ratna ləvih patenana kaṅ añoloṅ ikā denira saṅ amava bhūmi.

    §243 yen hana voṅ añoloṅ kbo sa⟨m⟩pi, paṅiridira saṅ ləvih, makādi saṅ amava bhūmi kaṅ adṛ(ve) paṅirid, yen añoloṅ guguluniṅ paḍati, kaṅ añoluṅ tugəlana sukune satəṅah denira saṅ amava bhūmi.

    (420)

    §244 riṅ voṅ sāhasa aṅrusāk grahanira saṅ ləvih, aṅrusak titiṅkahanira saṅ amava bhūmi aṅrusak gənah iṅ sañjata, aṅrusakabuyutan, amalat gajah, amalat ajaran, ratha paṅiridira saṅ amava bhūmi den-valat aṅ voṅ, ikā ta kaṅ amalat patenana denira saṅ amava bhūmi, tan rasanana, yen harəp ahuripa kaṅ amalat ikā, yen iṅapura denira saṅ amava bhūmi ḍəṇḍan ikā denira salima deniṅ voṅ maṅkana.

    (421)(422)

    §245 riṅ guru, riṅ rare, riṅ voṅ atuva vayahe, riṅ brāhmaṇa, riṅ voṅ vatək aṅaji, kunəṅ sakalviraniṅ kaṅ sinəṅguh saṅ paṇḍita, liṅniṅ loka, yen ātatāyi, sa⟨sa⟩cihna sayakti ulahe, paran ta kaṅ ātatāyi iṅaranan? voṅ anunoni umah iṅ voṅ, makādi anunoni umahira saṅ amava bhūmi, riṅ voṅ aṅupasi sasamane voṅ, riṅ voṅ anəluh sasamane voṅ, riṅ voṅ aṅamuk, amiśunakən saṅ amava bhūmi, riṅ voṅ amurugul, kaṅ nəm iku tan yogya huripən denira saṅ amava bhūmi, tan raṣanana patine, yen sacihna sadoṣa, yen sira amateni voṅ ātatāyi ikā, tan kataman pāpapātaka sira, maṅkana kapagəhanira riṅ dharmanira saṅ amava bhūmi.

    §246 riṅ voṅ aṅgaməli rabiniṅ arabi, tugəlana taṅane kaṅ aṅgaməli denira saṅ amava bhūmi, iku ḍəṇḍane, tur cihnanana tuṇḍuṅen sakiṅ deśanira, iku tətəṅəre, yen aṅgaməli rabiniṅ voṅ.

    §247 riṅ voṅ aṅucap-ucap lavan rabiniṅ arabi, riṅ śunya riṅ taman, riṅ alas, riṅ kali, ⟨EdJ: 87⟩ sagənahane aṅucap-ucap uṣ kikivan uga hana səmune mariṅ voṅ vadon ikā, naṅiṅ tan kalavanan deniṅ vadon, voṅ vadon ikā tan istri rabiniṅ arabi, tan kapiṅhit, ⟨kiṅ⟩ anəmoni guyu, aṅujarvatiṅ strīsaṅgrahaṇa arane, ḍəṇḍanən kaṅ anəmoni guyu ikā limaṅ tali, saṅkane aṇḍik ḍəṇḍane, rehiṅ voṅ vadon tan kapiṅhit, dudu laraṅan iṅ uttamajanma.

    (423)(424)(425)

    §248 riṅ voṅ aṅucap-ucap lavan rabiniṅ voṅ tumul(i) kapiṅ(h)it dene lakine voṅ uttamajanma, ikusaṅgrahaṇa arane...

    (426)

    §249 yen aṅucap-ucap kararaṅguhan iṅ asəpi, aṅhiṅ dene ararasan ika, tan akāraṇa sakiṅ harəp iṅ voṅ vadon ikā, tan asəmu paṅucap-ucap iṅ basaja, kevala sakiṅ tan vəruhe riṅ laki, riṅ voṅ maṅkana ḍəṇḍanən limaṅ tali, doṣane [BR464 lacuna begins] strīsaṅgrahaṇa kalilane (corr. kaliṅane) riṅ voṅ lanaṅ lavan voṅ vadon, yen ujar iṅ śāstra, tan vənaṅ yen asapocapana riṅ asəpi, lavan rabiniṅ arabi, yen rabihaniṅ sanak, rabihaniṅ paman, uva kunəṅ, rabihaniṅ anakmantu sakalviraniṅ stri laraṅan, tan yogya rovaṅaniṅ sapocapan riṅ asəpi, tan ulahanira saṅ vəruh iṅ haṅ (corr. saṅ hyaṅ) āgama, apan maṅkana dharmaniṅ dadi jahaṅət iṅ brahma.

    §250 riṅ voṅ amahugi rabiniṅ arabi , lavan amahugi laraṅaniṅ alaraṅan, amahugiha riṅ kavula dāsihnira saṅ ləvih, makādi kavulanira saṅ amava bhūmi, amahugi pinahugi deniṅ voṅ vadon, akāraṇa paḍa karəpe, kaṅ denpahugekən burat, kəmbaṅ, suvəṅ, ali-ali, ladiṅ panunuratan, paṅririṅgitan , dodot, bhūṣaṇa, sapavevehiṅ amahugi uga pavevehe kaṅ lanaṅ, manih pavevehe kaṅ vadon ikā, katəmu asisivo lavan voṅ vadon riṅ asəpi, makādi yen aṅguguṇanana , iku strīsaṅgrahaṇa arane , ḍəṇḍa pati doṣane, maṅkana liṅ saṅ paṇḍita.

    (427)(428)(429)(430)(431)(432)(433)(434)(435)(436)(437)(438)(439)(440)(441)(442)

    §251 riṅ voṅ abәcik kula kajātine, iṅuṅgahan deniṅ rarā, tan doṣanana kaṅ iṅuṅgahan ikā, denira saṅ amava bhūmi . riṅ voṅ asor kajātine, sor kulane, iṅuṅgahan iṅ rarā menak kajātine, pisahakəna rarā ikā lavan kaṅ den-uṅgahi, huvus apisah , takonana denira voṅ-atuvane rarā ikā, yen dudu karəpe mantu voṅ lanaṅ sor kulane ikā, patenana voṅ lanaṅ ikā denira, rarā ikā ulihakəna mariṅ rarāmane manih , yen paḍa karəpe rarā ikā lavan rarāmane lanaṅ, voṅ lanaṅ kasor kulane ikā, aveha tukon mariṅ bapaniṅ rarā ikā, javi kapatəh arane.

    (443)(444)(445)(446)(447)(448)(449)(450)(451)(452)(453)(454)(455)(456)

    §252 riṅ voṅ vadon amamaraṅ , akon alakiha riṅ mitrane vadon, lavan hana voṅ vadon sapadaluran lavan voṅ vadon luṅhā atatavan iṅiṅgatakәn deniṅ voṅ lanaṅ, manih hana voṅ vadon aveh dunuṅan iṅ voṅ luṅhā , riṅ voṅ vadon maṅkana, katəlu iku ḍəṇḍanən pataṅ tali denira saṅ amava bhūmi.

    (457)(458)(459)(460)(461)(462)(463)(464)(465)(466)(467)

    §253 riṅ voṅ muṅgah mariṅ paturoniṅ apaturon, tan pakone kaṅ adr̥ve umah , nora amet dr̥ve, kevala muṅgah, yenvəṅi kālane, ḍəṇḍanən roṅ lakṣa denira saṅ amava bhūmi, yen rahina kālane muṅgah ḍəṇḍa limaṅ tali , yen asiṅidan hana den- kavədeni , ḍəṇḍa saṅaṅ tali təluṅ atak, yen təka sakiṅ tan-vəruhe ḍəṇḍa nəm tali samās, yen amarani sakiṅ agalake, tur anaṅtaṅ, tan aṅunuskəris, ḍəṇḍa salakṣa, aṅunus kəris, tur aməraṅ saka, vaton, galar , ḍəṇḍa roṅ lakṣa denira saṅ amava bhūmi, yen dadi vicāra riṅ mañjiṅ iṅ umah maṅkana doṣane, yen kaṅ adr̥ve umah tan harəp amicāraha riṅ mañjiṅ iṅ umahiṅ aumah, tur aṅunus kәris sākṣaṇa vənaṅ patihane dene kaṅ adr̥ve umah, tan vicaranən .

    (468)(469)(470)(471)(472)(473)(474)(475)(476)(477)(478)(479)(480)(481)(482)(483)(484)(485)(486)(487)(488)(489)(490)(491)(492)(493)(494)(495)(496)(497)(498)(499)

    §254 riṅ voṅ tinambaṅ deniṅ lakine , kaṅ lanaṅ luṅhā amet dharma, atakitaki, ulahayu , antinən dene kaṅ vadon voluṅ tahun, yen luṅhā aṅaji amet śāstra antəkna nəm tahun , yen luṅhā adagaṅ, alayar, amet artha, antekna sapuluh tahun, yen luṅhā arabi antekna təluṅ tahun , yen ora akikirim kaṅ lanaṅ riṅ rabine ikā , vənaṅ alakiya riṅ len . riṅ voṅ vadon tinambaṅ dene lakine kaṅ lanaṅ apaparan anduradeśa , antinən pataṅ tahun dene voṅ vadon ikā, nora təka pataṅ tahun, vənaṅ kaṅ vadon alakiya riṅ len.

    (500)(501)(502)(503)(504)(505)(506)(507)(508)(509)(510)(511)(512)(513)(514)(515)(516)

    §255 riṅ voṅ vadon alaki riṅ len, yen kaṅ lanaṅ mula hilaṅ, māti riṅ parane kunәṅ , karuṅu lumaku viku , kumiṅ tan kavaśa riṅ saṅgama, makādi vuḍug larane , yen maṅkana tiṅkahiṅ voṅ lanaṅ ikā , kaṅ vadon vənaṅ alakiya riṅ len.

    (517)(518)(519)(520)(521)(522)

    §256 riṅ voṅ lanaṅ yen edan-edanən, yen ahriṅ aṅgirih larane, yen ayan larane, kumiṅ tan lanaṅ vəkasan elik kaṅ vadon, antinən təluṅ tahun, voṅ lanaṅ ikā dene rabine, konən aṅulatana tamba yen tan varas iṅ təluṅ tahun kaṅ lanaṅ ikā, tan doṣanana voṅ vadon ikā, yen alakiya riṅ len, sapanukune, tan muliya mariṅ voṅ lanaṅ ikā, aṅanti səminiṅ paṅ akiṅ arane.

    §257 riṅ voṅ vadon elik iṅ lakine, antinak satahun dene lakine, yen malər elik riṅ satahun voṅ vadon ikā, amaṅsulakəna tukon anikəla piṇḍo amañcal turon arane.

    (523)

    §258 ⟨svyaṅ⟩? yan saṅ brāhmaṇa arabi papat, sahos kanakṣabrāhmaṅabmakā, dumana savəlasan uga, tan vehana sapadumaniṅ kaṅ mətu sakiṅ brāhmaṇī, sakiṅ kṣatriyā, sakiṅ voṅ tani, sakiṅ (voṅ) adagaṅ, tan paḍakəna, maṅkana dharmaniṅ saratka.

    §259 hana ta vətuniṅ anak rovəlas ucapən maṅke ⟨EdJ: 90⟩ liṅ bhaṭāra madu mavarah riṅ janma kabeh, iṅətakəna sapatiṅ ambatgave, nənəm kehiṅ anak, vehana dr̥ve kaliliran, kaṅ nənəmaniṅ anak tan vehana dr̥ve kaliliran, paran ta patuṅgal-tuṅgalane? anakiṅ ragisakan rarehan duk paḍa jajaka rara, olihiṅ ramā-reṇa amaraṅ, rabi kapiṅroniṅ aomah-omah, huvus akiṅa tuvi, bhaṅiṅ tan hana pocapane hala, tan pavada, tur kinon alakiha deniṅ rāma-reṇane, anak pavevehiṅ sanak, kadaṅ varga, anak pinalaku anakiṅ voṅ len, anak olihiṅ rabi abibisan, kinon deniṅ laki, saṅkane anak-anak, anakiṅ voṅ len debuñjal pinupu-pupu iṅaku anak, hinubaṅ nənəm, vənaṅ amet(a) dr̥ve ⟨li⟩ kaliliran. əndi ta kaṅ nənəm(a)ne (nora) vənaṅ ameta dr̥ve kaliliran? anak səḍəṅiṅ rarā tan kasapekṣan kaṅ pinakabapa, anak casaruban akehanḍuha, anakiṅ voṅ vadon apəpəgatan lavan lakine tumuli alaki riṅ len, mahu kavorran voṅ vadon ikā, mati lakine kaṅ piṇḍo, tan alavas muli(h) r(iṅ) lakine mula anutugadən dadihanirara ikā, anak⟨iṅ⟩ olihiṅ atuku, anakiṅ voṅ len amalaku iṅaku anak, anakiṅ kavula sor kavoṅane iṅaku anak.

    (524)(525)(526)(527)

    §260 yen anak paveveh, lavan anakiṅ voṅ len ginave anak, vehana satəṅah dum-dumane, tan milu kaduman-duman riṅ aṅaku anak, yenora (h)ana anak təmən, vənaṅ i(ka)ṅ anak paveveh, anakiṅ len (g)inave anak, aṅalapa siṅ sadr̥veniṅ aṅaku anak.

    §261 riṅ dr̥ve vinevehakən iṅ rabine deniṅ lakine, manih riṅ anak vineha(n) dr̥ve deniṅ bapa, duk lagi huripe kasapekṣan deniṅ anak-rabi jīvane arane, riṅ dr̥ve maṅkana tan mənaṅ udalən deniṅ palara sanak kaṅ mətu sana rabi len, kaṅ vinehan j(i)vadana, huta viśeṣa riṅ dr̥ve paveveh ikā. ⟨EdJ: 91⟩

    (528)(529)(530)

    §262 tiṅkahiṅ putra riṅ pisis, varahakəna patutuṅgalan ikaṅ arane, kāyavr̥ddhi, voṅ a⟨p⟩mutrani aṅkokiṅave, abotadaṅan, kālavr̥ddhi voṅ ahutaṅ amətoni naṅ⟨an⟩kən vulan, karaka voṅ ahutaṅ tinuduhan gave, cakravr̥ddhi voṅ ah(u)taṅ anikəl aṅguluṅ putrane, papat kehiṅ kalāntara putraniṅ pisis, maṅkana yenujar iṅ śāstra.

    (531)(532)(533)

    §263 tiṅkahiṅ putraniṅ pisis, aputra naṅkən vulan hiṅane riṅ pisis sevu aputraha roṅ daśa, pataṅ daśa, limaṅ daśa, maṅkana putraniṅ pisisniṅ sevu naṅkən vulan deniṅ pradana amutrakakən, anuta varṇaniṅ ahutaṅ.

    (534)

    §264 . . katuturakəna ikā, kāyikā vr̥ddhi, kālikā vr̥ddhi kāritā vr̥ddhi, cakravr̥ddhi, ləvih ika, śikhavr̥ddhi aputra pipilan, bhogavr̥ddhi aputra paṅan, aṅupaya siṅ enak, vinehakən iṅ gənahe ahutaṅ salviraniṅ putra, tan aṅəloṅa pavita⟨ṅa⟩n.

    (535)

    §265 maṅkana manih riṅ ⟨pi⟩hutaṅ pisis, panikəle piṅro, dodot anikəl piṅ təlu uga, yan hutaṅ pari anikəl piṅ lima uga, yan ahutaṅ kombala, ahutaṅ tutuggaṅan, ahutaṅ guci, yen riṅ nəm tahun anikəl piṅ lima uga, maṅkana kramane yen anut śāsananiṅ ahutaṅ.

    (536)

    §266 kunəṅ yen ahutaṅ ajaran vadon, kəbo vadon, sapi vadon, yen təka riṅ luṅ tahun tuṅgal muliha roro; iku kramane.

    §267 riṅ bhukten pucaṅ, riṅ tisan, badeg, savalan, vovohan sakalviriṅ vovohan, yen olihiṅ am(i)śeṣa bhukti(,) bhukti kinavaśakən iṅ len, sakiṅ kəlare, kaṅ adr̥ve bhukti viniśeṣa ika ta kaṅ aṅgaduhi surat pikukuh akeh sākṣine duk vinehan piyagəma(n) dene kaṅ aveh, aṅhiṅ kinavaśakən dene kaṅ amiśeṣa bhukti ikā, sakiṅ tan kavaśaniṅ kaṅ adr̥ve bhukti, den-ḍahut ⟨EdJ: 92⟩ tan kaḍahut, aṅhiṅ malər anali-nali, ika ta arane bhukti śakti dene kaṅ amiśe(ṣa) ambhukti arane bhukti⟨n⟩ tan yukti liṅniṅ śāstra maṅkana.

    §268 apan iṅ bhukti bhinukti deniṅ len kinvavuhan deniṅ adr̥ve bhūmi⟨.⟩ riṅ roṅ puluh tahun lavase bhinukti deniṅ para mənəṅ tan paṅucap kaṅ adr̥ve bhukti, yan maṅkana hilaṅ dr̥vene bhūmine, maṅkana hinaṅ pavevehira s(i)ṅ vatək dāna, bhuktinən deniṅ voṅ len, akaraṇa sakiṅ valate hilaṅ pavevehira saṅ aveveh, yadyapin ikaṅ ⟨riṅ⟩ mas tuvi, vinalat iṅ para, sakiṅ vədine amanəpakuha riṅ mas kaṅ den-valat deniṅ voṅ ikā, mənəṅ tan paṅucap kaṅ adr̥ve riṅ sadaśa tahun lavase, hilaṅ ikaṅ samaṅkana.

    (537)(538)(539)(540)

    §269 yen hana dr̥ve ⟨savadnaniṅ dr̥ve⟩ sarupavarṇaniṅ dr̥ve, den-tiṅgalakən dene kaṅ adr̥ve, rakṣanə(n) denira saṅ prabhu adr̥ve bhūmi rumuhun lavasira aṅrakṣaha təluṅ tahun, yen livat sakerika ikaṅ dr̥ve ⟨riṅ təluṅ tahun⟩ petən deni(ra) saṅ amava bhūmi, apan dr̥vyanira ikā.

    §270 manih tiṅkahiṅ kavula, saṅkanedadi kavula, aṅavula dene katavan, aṅavula deniṅ paṅan, aṅavula duk mahu mətu sakiṅ rarāmane vadon mətu riṅ umahe gustine , kavula olihiṅ atuku , kavula paveveh iṅ voṅ, kavula kaliliran sakiṅrarāma lanaṅ vadon , aṅavula dene kaḍəṇḍa, pipitu saṅkaniṅ dadi kavulaniṅ voṅ , riṅ kavula maṅkana ta kabeh, yen harəp saha sakiṅ gustine, anəbusā hutaṅ rumuhun.

    (541)(542)(543)(544)(545)(546)(547)(548)(549)(550)(551)(552)(553)(554)(555)(556)(557)(558)(559)(560)(561)

    §271 kunəṅ riṅ voṅ ahutaṅ sakiṅ paṅane, yen tan alavas dene aṅavula, hanahura samulene kaṅ den-paṅan salavase tan kavaśa anambut gavene gustine.

    (562)(563)(564)(565)(566)(567)

    §272 riṅ voṅ amarāśraya aṅher bhūminiṅ abhūmi, deśaniṅ adeśa, aṅavula⟨EdJ: 93⟩ kinavulakən tan harəp , viniddhi kinonkon deniṅ gusti deniṅ lobhaniṅ amarāśraya , gustine ḍəṇḍanən salakṣa , denira saṅ amava bhūmi.

    (568)(569)(570)(571)(572)(573)(574)(575)(576)(577)

    §273 riṅ voṅ adol kavula tan yogya dolən, tan kaharəpe dinol, den-viśeṣa dene kaṅ adol , ḍəṇḍanən salakṣa kaṅ adol denira saṅ amava bhūmi.

    (578)(579)(580)(581)(582)(583)(584)

    §274 riṅ voṅ anambani nora vəruh riṅ oṣadha , nora vəruh riṅ mantra prayoga , tan vəruh tatvaniṅ lara , aṅalap ta ya paṅhəbaṅ-həbaṅ riṅ voṅ agəriṅ ikā, riṅ voṅ maṅkana paḍakəna lavan maliṅ , liñok riṅ voṅ anambani maṅkana, yen anambani upacāra tanvaras avəkasan mati , ḍəṇḍanən pataṅ tali təluṅ atak, yen anambani voṅ tan varas anuli mati, ḍəṇḍa salakṣa, yen anambani riṅ saṅ brāhmaṇa , tan varas anuli mati, ḍəṇḍa roṅ lakṣa denira saṅ amava bhūmi, yen mati kaṅ den- tambani , vənaṅ patenana kaṅ anambani ikā, denira saṅ amava bhūmi, maṅkana pagәhiṅ dharma , śāsananiṅ samavarṇa .

    (585)(586)(587)(588)(589)(590)(591)(592)(593)(594)(595)(596)(597)(598)(599)(600)(601)(602)(603)(604)(605)(606)(607)

    §275 nihan lviriṅ voṅ yogya gavenən sākṣi , voṅ agave gr̥ha , sugih mas pirak voṅ akeh anake , voṅ pagәh sugih riṅ tani , voṅ vruh riṅ dharma, vidagḍa riṅ aji śāstrāgama, voṅ vruh iṅ ala-hayuniṅ śīla yukti .

    (608)(609)(610)(611)(612)(613)(614)(615)(616)

    Apparatus


    ^1. aṣṭaduṣṭa varahakəna] Le2 Le3 Lo Ma Ja EdJ EdHH , aṣṭaduṣṭa maṅke varahakəna Le1
    ^2. amateni] Le1 Le2 Lo Ma Ja EdJ EdHH , amatenin Le3
    ^3. amatenana] Le1 Le2 Lo Ma EdJ EdHH , amatenin Le3 , amateni Ja
    ^4. aṅaninivoṅ tan padoṣa,] • This sentence is represented twice in Le1 , an illegible gap intervening.
    ^5. aṅanini] Le1 Le2 Lo Ma EdJ EdHH , anatonin Le3 (lexical), aṅani Ja (haplography)
    ^6. akəmbulan paṅan lavan] Le3 Lo Ma EdJ EdHH , akbulan paṅan lavan Le1 , akəmbulan lavan Le2 , akəmbulan paṅan lava Ja
    ^7. saparane lavan duṣṭa] Le1 Le2 Lo Ma EdJ EdHH , saparane duṣṭa Le3 (syntactic), pan parane duṣṭa Ja
    ^8. amitra lavan duṣṭa,] Le1 Le3 EdJ EdHH , samitra lavan duṣṭa, Le2 , hamamitra lavan duṣṭa, Lo, apamitra lavan duṣṭa, Ma, om. Ja
    ^9. aveh] Le1 Le3 Lo Ma EdJ EdHH , agave Le2 (lexical), veh Ja
    ^10. riṅ] Le1 Le3 Lo Ma EdJ EdHH , iṅ Le2 Ja

    ^13. kaṅ lilima] Le1 Le2 Le3 Lo Ma EdJ EdHH , kaṅ alilima Ja
    ^14. katuturana] em., katuturəna Le1 Le2 Le3 Lo Ma Ja EdJ EdHH
    ^15. patutuṅgalane] Le1 Le2 Lo Ma EdJ EdHH , patuṅgal-tuṅgalane Le3 , riṅ patuṅgal-tuṅgalane Ja
    ^16. ta] Le1 Le2 Le3 Lo Ma EdJ EdHH , om. Ja
    ^17. adoṣa] Le1 Le2 Le3 Lo Ma EdJ EdHH , doṣa Ja

    ^19. riṅ akon amatenana] Le2 Lo Ma EdJ EdHH , riṅ akonana amateni Le1 , riṅ voṅ akon amatenin Le3 , riṅ akon amateni Ja

    ^21. riṅ anatoni] Le1 Le2 Lo Ma EdJ EdHH , riṅ voṅ hanatonin Le3 , aṅanini Ja (lexical)
    ^22. adoṣa] Le1 Le2 Le3 Lo Ma EdJ EdHH , doṣa Ja
    ^23. lavan duṣṭa] Le1 Le2 Lo Ma Ja EdJ EdHH , om. Le3
    ^24. samitra lavan duṣṭa, sapaduluran saparanelavan duṣṭa,] Thus formulated in Le2 Le3 Lo Ma EdJ EdHH , sapaduluran saparane lavan duṣṭa, samitra lavan duṣṭa sapaduluran saparane lavan duṣṭa, samitra lavan duṣṭa Le1 , sapaduluran parane duṣṭa, samitra lavan duṣṭa Ja
    ^25. samitra] Le2 Lo Ma EdJ EdHH , hasamittha Le3 sapaduluran saparane lavan duṣṭa, samitra lavan duṣṭa sapaduluran saparane lavan duṣṭa, samitra lavan duṣṭa Le1 , sapaduluran parane duṣṭa, samitra lavan duṣṭa Ja
    ^26. saparane] Le1 Le3 EdJ EdHH , om. Le2 sapaduluran saparane lavan duṣṭa, samitra lavan duṣṭa sapaduluran saparane lavan duṣṭa, samitra lavan duṣṭa Le1 , sapaduluran parane duṣṭa, samitra lavan duṣṭa Ja
    ^27. lavan] Le1 Le3 EdJ EdHH , om. Le3 sapaduluran saparane lavan duṣṭa, samitra lavan duṣṭa sapaduluran saparane lavan duṣṭa, samitra lavan duṣṭa Le1 , sapaduluran parane duṣṭa, samitra lavan duṣṭa Ja
    ^28. riṅ] Le1 Le2 Le3 Lo EdJ EdHH , iṅ Ma Ja
    ^29. iku ta] Le2 Le3 Lo Ma Ja EdJ EdHH , iku aṣṭaduṣṭa harane Le1
    ^30. kaṅ lilima] Le1 EdJ , kalilima Le2 Ja, kalima Le3 Lo Ma, kaṅ lima EdHH • None of the variant readings that appear in this segment affect the meaning, as all variants refer to the same idea of ‘all five as a whole’. According to OJED, lima has a variant form lilima; thus, the form kalima, which is also attested, is morphologically coherent with kalilima. The choice of kaṅ lilima in this edition is intended to maintain consistency with the form selected earlier at the beginning of this article, ensuring editorial coherence throughout.
    ^31. adoṣa] Le2 Le3 Lo Ma Ja EdJ EdHH , doṣanana Le1
    ^32. nora vənaṅ doṣanana pati] Le2 Le3 Lo Ma EdJ EdHH , nora vənaṅ yan doṣanana pata Ja, om. Le1
    ^33. denira saṅ amava bhūmi.] Le2 Le3 Lo Ma Ja EdJ EdHH , om. Le1
    ^34. amateni voṅ tan padoṣa,] Ma Ja EdJ EdHH , om. Le1 , amateni tan padoṣa, Le2 Lo, amatenin voṅ tan padoṣa, amatenin voṅ tan padoṣa, Le3 (dittography)
    ^35. akon amatenana voṅ tan padoṣa,] Le2 Lo EdJ EdHH , om. Le1 , akon amatenin voṁ tan padoṣa. Le3 , akon amatenī voṁ tan padoṣa, Ma, akon amateni tan padoṣa, Ja
    ^36. anatoni voṅ tan padoṣa.] Lo Ma EdJ EdHH , om. Le1 , anatonana voṅ tan padoṣa. Le2 , om. Le3 (eye-skip), anatoni tan padoṣa. Ja
    ^37. duṣṭa tətəlu iku,] Le2 Lo EdJ EdHH , om. Le1 , iku duṣṭa kaṅ tətәlu Le3 (transposition), duṣṭa tətəlu ika, Ma, om. Ja

    ^39. katəlu ḍəṇḍa pati,] Le2 Le3 Lo EdJ EdHH , om. Le1 , kaṅ təlu ḍəṇḍa pati, Ma, kaṅ tətəlu ḍəṇḍa pati, Ja
    ^40. arane katәlu duṣṭa atoh avake,] Le2 Le3 Lo Ja EdJ EdHH , om. Le1 , arane katәlu duṣṭa atoh avaṅke Ma
    ^41. yan amalaku huripən iṅ saṅ amava bhūmi,] Le3 Lo Ma EdJ EdHH , om. Le1 , yan amaku huripən iṅ saṅ amava bhūmi, Le2 , yan amalaku ripən denira saṅ amava bhūmi, Ja
    ^42. katəlu ḍəṇḍanən pataṅ lakṣa vivijinən iṅ duṣṭa satuṅgal-satuṅgal kahilaṅane doṣane.] Lo Ma EdJ EdHH , om. Le1 , katəlu ḍəṇḍanən pataṅ lakṣa viji-vijinən iṅ duṣṭa satuṅgal-satuṅgal kahilaṅane doṣane. Le2 , katәlu ḍaṇḍanən voluṁ lakṣa, vivijinən iṅ ḍuṣṭa satuṅgal-satuṅgal, kahilaṅaniṅ doṣane. Le3 , katәlu ḍaṇḍanən, voluṁ lakṣa viji-vijinən riṅ satuṅgal-satuṅgal, kahilaṅane. Ja
    ^43. anadene kaṅ sapaṅan lavan duṣṭa,] Le2 Lo EdJ EdHH , om. Le1 , anadene sapaṅan lavan duṣṭa, Le3 , anadene kaṅ sapaṅan lava duṣṭa, Ma, na ne sapaṅan lavan duṣṭa, Ja
    ^44. sadulur lavan duṣṭa,] Le2 Lo Ma EdJ EdHH , Le1 , sapaduluran saparane lavan duṣṭa, Le3 , sapaduluran lavan duṣṭa, Ja

    ^65. iṅiṅgatakən deniṅ voṅ len, katəmu dene gustine, kaṅ aṅiṅgatakən kaḍəṇḍaha pataṅ lakṣa denira saṅ amava bhūmi. anadene hutaṅe voṅ vadon kaṅ iṅiṅgatakən ikā, mulih anikəl saguṅiṅ hutaṅ mariṅ gustine voṅ vadon ikā, tur palakonana pavadal-gave salavase miṅgat sakiṅ gustine, apan maliṅ araniṅ voṅ aṅiṅgatakən kavulaniṅ voṅ.] Le1 Le2 Le3 Lo Ma EdJ EdHH , om.     ^127. sakalviraniṅ bhukti,] Le2 Lo Ma Ja EdJ EdHH , sakalvirriṁ bukṭi, Le3 , sakalviraniṅ i nukti Le1

    ^129. kasapekṣan deniṅ voṅ akeh] Le2 Le3 Lo Ma Ja EdJ EdHH , kasapekṣa deniṁ voṁṅ ake Le1

    ^134. -niṅ] Le2 Le3 Lo Ma Ja EdJ EdHH , -ni Le1

    Bibliography

    First edited by Jonker mainly from Le1. Edited again by Hoadley & Hooker from Lo. The text of Jonker’s edition OCR-ed and checked by Arlo Griffiths & Timothy Lubin. Based thereon, this digitial edition was prepared by Nurmalia Habibah with collation of eight witnesses.

    References

    Jonker, Johan Christoph Gerhard. 1885. Een Oud-Javaansch wetboek vergeleken met Indische rechtsbronnen. Leiden: Brill. [URL].

    Hoadley, Mason C. and M. B. Hooker. 1981. An introduction to Javanese law: A translation of and commentary on the Agama. Monographs of the Association for Asian Studies, 37. Tucson, AZ: Published for the Association for Asian Studies by the University of Arizona Press. [URL].

    . xml:id="kutaraManava">
    . <teiHeader>
    . <fileDesc>
    10 <titleStmt>
    . <title type="editorial">Kuṭāra Mānava: Digital Critical Edition and Translation of an Old Javanese Penal Code</title>
    . <!-- <title type="original"></title> not filled in because unclear of KM is actually the original title-->
    . <respStmt>
    . <resp>author of digital edition</resp>
    15 <persName ref="part:nuha">
    . <name>Nurmalia Habibah</name>
    . </persName>
    . </respStmt>

    . <pubPlace>Paris (France)</pubPlace>

    . <date from="2019" to="2025">2019-2025</date>

    . <sourceDesc>
    . <listWit>
    . <listWit xml:id="mssleiden">
    . <head>Manuscripts kept in Leiden</head>
    35 <witness xml:id="le1">
    . <abbr type="siglum">Le<hi rend="subscript">1</hi>
    . </abbr>
    . <msDesc>
    . <msIdentifier>
    40 <settlement>Leiden</settlement>
    . <institution>Leiden University Libraries (UB)</institution>
    . <repository>Bijzondere collecties</repository>
    . <idno>Or. 2215</idno>
    . </msIdentifier>
    45 <physDesc>
    . <p>This Balinese palm-leaf manuscript served as the primary witness (referred to as <q>I</q>) in Jonker’s edition. According to Jonker, the manuscript lacks a title, with the only external identifier being the word <foreign>agama</foreign> inscribed on its outer surface. No additional information about its date of composition or copying is available. The manuscript contains 275 articles and is relatively complete compared to other witnesses. However, the final paragraph on leaf 71v ends abruptly in mid-sentence, just after <q>
    . <foreign>voṁṅ ake</foreign>
    . </q>. The manuscript consists of 71 leaves, each bearing either three or four lines of text on both faces. Despite being in relatively good condition overall, it exhibits minor damage in a few areas. However, it is riddled with errors and omissions, with the quality of the handwriting noticeably deteriorating toward the end.</p>
    . <handDesc>
    50 <p/>
    . </handDesc>
    . </physDesc>
    . </msDesc>
    . </witness>
    55 <witness xml:id="le2">
    . <abbr type="siglum">Le<hi rend="subscript">2</hi>
    . </abbr>
    . <msDesc>
    . <msIdentifier>
    60 <settlement>Leiden</settlement>
    . <institution>Leiden University Libraries (UB)</institution>
    . <repository>Bijzondere collecties</repository>
    . <idno>Or. 3904</idno>
    . </msIdentifier>
    65 <physDesc>
    . <objectDesc>
    . <p>A Balinese 19th-century paper manuscript. This archival note or catalog entry refers to <q>Bundle 53</q>, which contains multiple texts or manuscripts grouped together. Bl. 1-54: Refers to folios (<foreign>bladen</foreign>) 1-54, which contain the text titled <title>Kutaramanawa</title>. Bl. 54-65: Refers to folios 54-65, which are labeled as containing the text titled <title>Swaradjambu</title> However, this designation may require further research and verification, as the <foreign>Kutaramanawa</foreign> is known to conclude with a <foreign>śloka</foreign> from the <title>Sārasamuccaya</title> This observation suggests that the delineation of texts within this bundle might not be entirely clear-cut, and there may be overlaps or textual continuations that merit closer philological examination.</p>
    . </objectDesc>
    . <handDesc>
    70 <p/>
    . </handDesc>
    . </physDesc>
    . </msDesc>
    . </witness>
    75 <witness xml:id="le3">
    . <abbr type="siglum">Le<hi rend="subscript">3</hi>
    . </abbr>
    . <msDesc>
    . <msIdentifier>
    80 <settlement>Leiden</settlement>
    . <institution>Leiden University Libraries (UB)</institution>
    . <repository>Bijzondere collecties</repository>
    . <idno>Or. 3954</idno>
    . </msIdentifier>
    85 <physDesc>
    . <objectDesc>
    . <p>This paper manuscript consists of handwritten text in Balinese script, meticulously arranged in structured lines across 82 pages. The manuscript is written on aged paper, the pages exhibit minor wear especially along the edges and binding. A label on the first page indicates Bundel 103, listing the contents, which include <title>Kuṭaramānāwa</title> and <title>Pāswara</title>. The first page provides a catalog entry: <title>Kuṭaramānāwa</title> (noted as a "digest") spans folios 1-143, while <title>Pāswara</title> spans folios 144-178. The <title>Kuṭaramānāwa</title> section contains legal articles that are jumbled and arranged in a non-sequential order. However, we can determine the correct sequence based on the numbers added in the left margin at the beginning of each line.</p>
    . </objectDesc>
    . <handDesc>
    90 <p/>
    . </handDesc>
    . </physDesc>
    . </msDesc>
    . </witness>
    95 </listWit>
    . <!-- end of Leiden mss. -->
    . <listWit xml:id="mssuk">
    . <head>Manuscripts kept in the UK</head>
    . <witness xml:id="lo1">
    100 <abbr type="siglum">Lo</abbr>
    . <msDesc>
    . <msIdentifier>
    . <settlement>London</settlement>
    . <institution>British Library (BL)</institution>
    105 <repository/>
    . <idno>Add. 12277</idno>
    . </msIdentifier>
    . <physDesc>
    . <objectDesc>
    110 <p>The British Museum manuscript, cataloged as No. 12277 Ad., referred to as <q>II</q> in Jonker’s edition, is written on palm leaves. Like the Leiden manuscript, it lacks a title as well as any reference to the place or date of its transcription. An external inscription identifies it as <foreign>Cuntara Manava Sastra</foreign>, described as a paraphrase of the Institutes of Manu in the Kawi (Old Javanese) language. It includes the note: <q>Presented to J. Crawfurd Esq. by the Rajah of Billing, 1814</q>. The manuscript is entirely intact and remarkably clear in its handwriting. It bears a striking resemblance to the Leiden manuscript, with the readings of the two aligning almost perfectly. The text ends at §182, on folio 63r line 1, and breaks off just before the final phrase, which according to other witnesses reads <q>
    . <foreign>kahilaṁṅan iṁ manaḥ muḍa</foreign>
    . </q>. Thus, the manuscript concludes just short of a complete sentence. This manuscript begins with a unique introductory passage (not paralleled in other witnesses). The preamble is a standalone didactic and philosophical reflection on ethical conduct, divine justice, scriptural reverence, and the proper attitude toward leadership and manuscript transmission—presented through metaphors, myths, and moral principles.</p>
    . <!-- Original preamble from London ms. (lo1), moved from body of the edition as suggested: ...
    .
    115@@L (lo1): ṇḍya ta: liṅira:, riṁ humuṅguḥ denamasti hiṁ sila:krama:, hambək maredḍa:lus tan ava:mana:, haṅgəṁ kasəmbahaniṁ saṁ deva pitr̥, hamriḥ kanurageṁ sama tumuvuḥ, tan aracuk cavuhiṁ raṣa: kayogyan·, jnək tumiru-tiru śrutiniṁṅ ajī śa:sra gmət·, tan aṅudokən manaḥ devek tulus tan pasakṣi, bvat gumiśa: baṅga: kuhaka:, tan kədva: malayokən tvas jajalukən·, havr̥ bot pupujiṁ lepya kalubaniṁ lobha:, sira-sira hisun-isun-hisun uga:, tan mapaR̥kaṁ ragha: dveṣa: kimburu, yekū kaṁ dumadya pahilanya,,
    .@@H (edH): ndya ta liṅ-ira, riṅ umuṅguh den-amasti iṅ sila-krama, ambək mareddha lustana vamana, aṅgəṅ kasəmbahan niṅ saṅ deva pitra, amrih kanurageṅ sama tumuvuh, tan aracuk tuvuh iṅ rasa kayogan, jnək tumiru-tiru sr̥uti niṅ ṅaji śāstra gmət, tan aṅudekən manah dhevek tulus tanpa saksi, bvat gumisa baṅga kuhaka, tan kədva malajokən tvasta jalukən, avrabot pupujiṅ lepya kalubaniṅ lontar, sira-sira isun-isun ṅisun uga, tan maparəkaṅ rāga dvesa kimbura, jeku kaṅ dumadya pahilanya.

    .@@L (lo1): tan ūmnəṁ vulat iṁ bala: hamarikṣa lara:lapanya, jəjəpən kavruhira: senak tan enaknya, priḥ kalulutanya huga paśevan·, katapiya: kamudḍa:n· varahna: krama hiya, yan purugən trapna: tata-ṣṭithiṅ ulaḥ, ḍuga-ḍuga: prayogha: riṁṅ anibanī vighraha: panakaryya, den kadi hamṭiki tatanman sarvva sarī kavvavahan·, haḍmit pinet luṅgaḥnya lumuṁ pva ya:vaśaṇanya, havaḥ sumək ṣumuhun skar manahiṁ bala:, deniṁ hamivḍen prayatna polata:n taṅlalari, katkaniṁ duṣṭa: dūrjjaṇa: maliṁ coraḥ, nyata: tan kalen kadḍi meda:niṁ miṇḍa, avḍya noniṁ kayu maḍəg·, An sumeṇḍe hinak pva ya parantunanya nūta: vivijaḥ, kaliṅanya tan pahiriṁ saṁ manuṅgaṅi raṭa: vihikan aśvameḍaniṁṅ asaratī, riṅ apan harohara: lakunya haparaṅ-aparūṁ, maṅkanenak taṇḍəlira: saṅ ha:maṅku bhūmī, yatanyan pamuhara: vighna: ri sira: ,, 0,,
    .@@H (edH): tan umnəṅ-vulat iṅ bala amariksa lara-lapanya, jəjəpən kavruhira senak tan enakəna, prih kalulu tan uga pasevan, katapiya kamuddhan varahna krama iya, jen purugən trapna tata-sthisi ṅulah, ḍuga-ḍuga prayogya riṅ ṅibani vigraha panakaryya, den-kadi aməṭiki tatanman sarva sari kavva vahan, aḍmit-pinet luṅgahnya lumuṅ pva ja vasananya, avah sumək sumuhun pkarmana iṅ bala, deniṅ amivdhen prayatna volatan ta ṅgalari, katkan iṅ duṣṭa durjjana maliṅ corah, nyata tan kalen kadi meḍan iṅ miṇḍa, avdaneniṅ kaju maḍəg, anpu mendhe inak pva ya parantun nuta vivijah, kaliṅanya tanpa iriṅ saṅ manuṅgaṅira tavihi kanasva Medhaṅ iṅ ṅasarati, riṅ apan ta Wetara lakunya aparaṅ-aparuṅ, maṅka nenak andhəl-ira saṅ ta maṅku bumi, ya tanyan pamuhara vigna risira

    .@@L (lo1): An maṅkaṇa: ya huñcaR̥n saṁ hyaṁ hajī pūrvvaḍigama, hayo riṅ aṅamplag-amplagən·, hapan maha:bha:ra:lita siṅhit sūśvareṅ akṣara:, riṅa-riṅhanən den-aśriṁ sisiriṅən pisiṅgihniṅ akveḥ, marapvan (tan?) vyartan kaparibhaveṁ kleśaniṅ aśarira:.
    .@@H (edH): ana maṅkana ya hunturən saṅ hyaṅ aji Pūrvādhigama, ajo riṅ aṅamplagan-plagәn, apan maha dharalita siṅgit susvare ṅakṣara, riṅ ariṅanən densriṅ siriṅen sisiṅganih ṅakveh, mavvenvyar tan kapariba voṅ kleśani-śarīra.

    315@@L (lo1): hana pva riṁ parvvaḍḍi liṅən·, hyaṁ yama:dipa: sira hupapatiniṁ devaṭa:, Aṣava: kahinan ṭa:rkka: riṁ parikṣayuṣa:, pakantukira: hatrap aṇḍah uṇḍiniṁ ḍaṇḍa:, vvaṁ tan salaḥ, kavighraha: riṁ viḍḍīvaṣa tmaḥ manuṣa:, sinurun sakiṁ deva:laya:, katkeṁ jana:loka:, deva tuvī katama riṁ patī, hiku kaṅ kayatna:kna,
    .@@H (edH): ana pva riṅ purvādhi liṅen, hyaṅ Yama Dipa sira upapati iṅ devata, asavaka hinantharka riṅ parīkṣa-yusa, pakantuk-ira atrapan dhahub deniṅ ḍəṇḍa, vvaṅ tan salah, kavigrah riṅ vidhi-vasatmah mānuṣa, sinurun sakiṅ Devalaya, katkeṅ Janaloka, deva tuvi kata mariṅ pati, iku kaṅ kayatna kəna.
    .

    .</app>
    .sakiṅ devālaya, katәkeṅ janaloka, deva tuvi katama riṅ pati, iku kaṅ kayatnākəna</p>
    345
    .@@L (lo1): Aṇa: vaneḥ bhagavan aḍḍī maṇḍavya sira:, maṅanakən braṭa: mona: maṣa:, kaspəriṁ maliṁ, rinuruḥ deniṁ taṇḍa:, katmu maṅəttaniṁ kuṇḍa, sinikəpva ya sinaṅkala:, tatapi saṁ brahmaṇa: kavaha: huga:vighraha:,,
    .@@H (edH): ana vaneh Bagavan Adhi Mandavya sira, maṅanaken Brata Mona Masa, kasper iṅ maliṅ, rinuruh deniṅ taṇḍa, katəmu maṅətətan iṅ kuṇḍa, sinikəp vaya sinaṅkala, tatapi saṅ Brahma na kavaha uga vigraha.
    .
    .<p>hana vaneh bhagavān adhi maṇḍavya sira, maṅanakәn brata mona masa, kasәpәr iṅ maliṅ, rinuruh deniṅ taṇḍa, katəmu maṅətan iṅ kuṇḍa,
    350<app>
    . <lem wit="#lo1">sinikəp pva ya</lem>
    . <rdg wit="#edh">sinikəp vaya</rdg>
    .</app>
    .sinaṅkala, tathāpi saṅ brāhmaṇa kavaha uga vigraha.</p>
    355
    .@@L (lo1): hakveḥ paribhaṣaniṁ tatvadyatmika:, maka:sipta vayeṃ parvva lyan· yekuṅgvaniṁ sumiriṅa:tagutagu,, riṅ a:mtokən puṣṭaka: tujunən ve rahayu, hagave maṅgala: rumuhun abr̥siha: silakrama pajəg pahenak manaḥta:, sambut saṁ hyaṁ Agama:yo sasalah iṅe, pan a:ṅuñcaR̥ṇna: vkasiṁ tumuvuḥ saṅsepanya, raṣa rinaṣa: yva hakaraṇa: cəṅhil acəcəṅgiṅən·, tan maṅkana: kajariṁṅ a:jī śastragama na:,, nihan vaneḥ ḍarṣaniya: R̥p səṅgunən añcik·, ḍarmma sūkla haprabha citta: tan kapaR̥kiṁ lubḍajana:,, tan amighraheṁ tan papidoṣa:, hapihnəṅiṁ hapidośa,, taha: vḍi hiṅ kinabhitan·, tan lagava riṅ avḍi,, tuhu hna: huga sakaraṇane, hayo paṅliṅ ya den-anula:ra:ṣa:,, kaliṅanya den-kavruha: huga ruhun·, rarasiṁ priṅga: ṭikṣṇaniṅ asayah abrat·, den-kadi duṅulaniṅ ka:ra phasaren śivalan·,, mapa ta: lviriṁ śivala{bh/n}n palaranya, supitən sari-sarī hapus i sanurnya pinək·,, riṅ ano phalaranya, palunən sarī-sarī heṅguṅən ubəsən iris-iris·,, kunaṁ hiṅ karambil·, vujəkən ginaR̥m sari-sari bəbəden atguḥ ri nəb·,, riṅ apa nora mtu ha:ḍuḥnya hamr̥ta:ni havurip·, siku-sikvakniṁ si phatukura śarira, sugyan pūrvvanya na sisip hamuṅgviṁ habaṅiṁ tuñjuṁ kinaviteṁ bañu, yeku manahiṁ veneḥ tan pahi lavan śarira:, śr̥dḍa: kinasr̥dḍa:n·,, maṅka:naṅ śarira:, hapanas kinaṭikṣṇan·,,
    .@@H (edH): hakveh paribasaniṅ tatvad tmika, makasipta vayeṅ parvvalyan yeku ṅgvan iṅ sumiriṅ tagu-tagu. riṅ amtokən pustaka tujunən verahyu, agave maṅgala rumuhun abrasiha sila-krama pajəg sahenak manah ta, sambut saṅ hyaṅ āgama yo sasalahiṅe, padaṅun turena vəkasiṅ tumuvuh saṅ Pesanya, rasa-rinasa yvah akāraṇa cəṅṅila ceceṅgiṅən, tan maṅkana kajariṅ ṅaji Sastragama na. nihan vaneh darśaniya reppeṅgubən antik, dharmaśukla aprāṇacitta tan kaparekiṅ lunda-jana. tan amigraheṅ tan papideśa, api hnəṅiṅ apideśa. ta havədi hiṅkinabitan, tan laga variṅ avədi, | tuhuhna uga sakaranane, ayo paṅliṅya den-kavruha uga ruhun, rarasiṅ priṅgatik sbaniṅ asaya hagrata, den-kadi duṅu lan iṅkara pasaren jīvalana. mapatal viriṅ siva lan palaranya, supiten sarisari apus isanurnya pinəka. riṅ avoṅ palaranya, palunen sarisari heṅguṅən ubəsəniri-sirisa. kunaṅ hiṅ karambəl, vujekən ginarəm pari-sari bəbə den atəguh rinəna. riṅ apa nera mətu haduhnya amratani havurip, siku sikvakniṅ si-patuku rasar-ira, sugyan purvanyana saṅ sipta muṅgviṅ tuntukən aviteṅ banu, yeku mana iṅ vəneh tan pahi lāvan śarīra, śrəddha-kinaśrəddhan. maṅkanaṅ śarīra, apan asəkinatik səbana.
    .

    . </objectDesc>
    . <handDesc>
    . <p/>
    . </handDesc>
    495 </physDesc>
    . </msDesc>
    . </witness>
    . <witness xml:id="ma1">
    . <abbr type="siglum">Ma</abbr>
    500 <msDesc>
    . <msIdentifier>
    . <settlement>Manchester</settlement>
    . <institution/>
    . <repository/>
    505 <idno>Bal. 2</idno>
    . </msIdentifier>
    . <physDesc>
    . <objectDesc>
    . <p>This Balinese palm-leaf manuscript, currently held in Manchester and written in Balinese script, comprises approximately 40 folios, of which 38 contain textual content. The manuscript concludes at §140, on folio 38v, and breaks off mid-sentence, lacking only a short final phrase to complete the clause. The abrupt ending confirms that the final paragraph is incomplete. Although the manuscript has no explicit title or colophon, it is well-preserved and legibly inscribed. The outer wooden covers bear the label <q>Balinese 2</q> and the annotation <q>Javanese MS</q>, providing limited external identifiers. </p>
    510 </objectDesc>
    . <handDesc>
    . <p/>
    . </handDesc>
    . </physDesc>
    515 </msDesc>
    . </witness>
    . </listWit>
    . <!-- end of UK mss -->
    . <listWit xml:id="jakartamss">
    520 <head>A manuscript kept in Jakarta</head>
    . <witness xml:id="ja1">
    . <abbr type="siglum">Ja</abbr>
    . <msDesc>
    . <msIdentifier>
    525 <settlement>Jakarta</settlement>
    . <institution>Perpustakaan Nasional Republik Indonesia</institution>
    . <repository>Koleksi Naskah Nusantara</repository>
    . <idno>Br. 464</idno>
    . </msIdentifier>
    530 <physDesc>
    . <objectDesc>
    . <p>This <foreign>Kuṭāramānawa</foreign> manuscript is a bound paper manuscript, exhibiting signs of age and careful preservation. The front cover features a marbled brown texture with a black spine, suggesting a modern rebinding for protection. A printed label with <q>
    . <title>Kutawamanawa</title>
    . </q> has been affixed to the cover, likely as a later addition for cataloging purposes. The original title, <q>
    535 <title>Kuṭāramānawa</title>
    . </q>, is handwritten on the first inner page, confirming the manuscript’s content. The manuscript is written on aged brown paper, which has darkened over time due to oxidation and exposure. The edges are slightly worn but remain intact, indicating careful handling or conservation efforts. The text is written in Balinese script, meticulously arranged in dense, continuous lines with even spacing. Western numerals appear in the top right corner, likely serving as folio or page numbers, while the page number in Balinese script is written at the top center of the page.</p>
    . </objectDesc>
    . <handDesc>
    . <p/>
    540 </handDesc>
    . </physDesc>
    . </msDesc>
    . </witness>
    . </listWit>
    545 <!-- end of Jakarta mss. -->

Among the following elements, you may keep only the ones your need for your edition. If you use one, its contents must be contained in at least one <p> of free text. If you don’t need any <editorialDecl> at all, you may eventually remove this entire section of the file. -->

    595 <revisionDesc>
    . <change who="part:axja" when="2024-10-20" status="draft">Creating an xml edition for the Kutara Manava</change>

    . <text xml:space="preserve">
    600 <body><div type="edition" xml:lang="kaw-Latn">
    . <div>
    . <!-- (alias "Kuṭāra Mānava" or "Āgama")
    .e-text based on Jonker’s edition, by Timothy Lubin, Arlo Griffiths and Nurmalia Habibah,
    .started around 2019, finished in 2024
    605
    .[Based on a comparison of the Jonker (= J) and Hoadley & Hooker (= H) editions, with standardized transliteration. Numbers in parentheses refer to numbered section in H. Square brackets enclose words omited in Jonker ed. Elided pepets restored. atikatik / paṅkon
    .Typed by Timothy Lubin.]
    .
    .§0 [‘introduction’, based on H (partly corrected by TL); deemed by J a later addition to the work and hence omitted by him]-->
    610
    .<ab xml:lang="san-Latn">avignam astu.</ab>
    .</div>
    .<div>
    .<!--
    615@@A (le1):
    .@@B (le2):
    .@@C (le3):
    .@@L (lo1):
    .@@M (ma1):
    620@@X (ja1):
    .@@J (edJ):
    .@@H (edH):
    .-->
    .<!-- #le1 #le2 #le3 #lo1 #ma1 #ja1 #edj #edh -->
    625<!--
    .@@A (le1): riṅ aṣṭadḍu:ṣṭa maṅke varahakna: ,, 0 ,, A:mateni voṁ [SH] tan padoṣa, hakon amatenana vo[ṁ] tan padoṣa,, A:ṅan[i]n[i] vo[ṁ] ta(n padoṣa,,) [+3][1r2]ṅanini tan padoṣa,, Akbulan<reg>Akəmbulan<\reg> paṅan lavan ḍuṣṭa,, ṣapaduluran saparane lavan ḍusṭa:,, A[SH]mitra lavan ḍuṣṭa,, haveḥ gnaḥ riṁ duṣṭa,, Atuluṁ duṣṭa,, Iku aṣṭaduṣṭa harane,, riṁ haṣṭadusṭa: [1r3] kaṁ tətlu hadoṣa pati kaṁ lilima hadoṣa harttha:,, katutuR̥na deniṁṅ aR̥p· vəruA [SH] patutuṅgalane,, hənḍi ta kaṅ adoṣa pati ,, 0 ,,
    .@@B (le2): riṁṅ aṣṭaduṣṭa varaha:kna. hamate- [01-02]ni voṁ tan padoṣa:, hakon amatenana: voṁ tan padoṣa, Aṅani- [01-03]ni voṁ tan padoṣa, Ak<subst><del rend="corrected">i</del><add place="overstrike">ә</add></subst>mbulan lavan duṣṭa:, sapadulura:n sapa<subst><del rend="strikeout">ṅa</del><add place="above">ra</add></subst>ne [01-04]lavan duṣṭa:, samitra lavan duṣṭa:, Agave gnaḥhiṁ duṣṭa:, hatulūṁ du- [01-05]ṣṭa:. Iku haṣṭaduṣṭa:, ṅa, riṁ haṣṭaduṣṭa kaṁ tətәlu hadoṣa patī, [01-06]kaṁ lilima hadoṣa Ar<subst><del rend="corrected">ṭa</del><add place="above">tha</add></subst>, katutuR̥na deniṁ haR̥p· vəruḥha pa- [01-07]tutuṅgallane,, həndi ta kaṁṅ a:doṣa patī, ,, 0,,
    .@@C (le3): riṁṅ aśṭaḍuśṭa varahakna:, [01-02]Amatenin voṁ tan padoṣa:, Akvan ama:tenin voṁ [01-03]tan padośa:, Anatonin voṁ tan padośa:, [01-04]Akәmbulan paṅan lavan ḍuśṭa:, sapaduluran saparane ḍu- [01-05]ṣṭa:, Amitra lavan ḍuṣṭa:, Aveḥ gnaḥ riṁ ḍuṣṭa:, Atuluṁ ḍu- [01-06]ṣṭa:, Iku haṣṭaḍuṣṭa harane, riṁṅ aṣṭaḍuṣṭa kaṁ tətәlu ha- [01-07]dośa pa:ti, kaṁ lilima hadośa hartha:, katuturR̥ṇa [01-08]deniṁṅ aR̥p· vəruha patuṅgal·-tuṅgalane, həndi ta [01-09]kaṁṅ a:dośa pati,,
    .@@L (lo1): riṅ aṣṭaduṣṭa: varaha:kna ,, 0,, hamateni voṁ tan padoṣa:,, hakon amatena:na voṁ tan padoṣa,, haṅaninī voṁ tan padoṣa,, hakəmbulan paṅa: n lavan ḍuṣṭa:,, sapaduluran saparane lavan ḍuṣṭa:,, hamamitra lavan ḍuṣṭa:,, haveḥ gnaḥ riṁ duṣṭa:,, hatuluṁ duṣṭa:,, Iku Aṣṭaduṣṭa ṅaranya,, riṁ Aṣṭa:duṣṭa kaṁ tətlu hadoṣa patī, kaṁ lilima: hadoṣa hartha, katutuR̥na deniṁ haR̥p· vəruha: patutuṅgalane,, həndi ta: kaṅ ha:dośa patī,, 0,,
    630@@M (ma1): riṁ haṣṭaduṣṭa varahakna ,, 0 ,, hamateni voṁ tan padoṣa [SH] , Akon amatenana voṁ tan padoṣa, Aṅanini voṁ tan padoṣa, hakəmbula[1v2]n paṅan lavan duṣṭa, sapaduluran saparane lavan duṣṭa, Apamitra lavan duṣṭa, haveḥ gnaḥ § [SH] riṁ duṣṭa, Atuluṁ duṣṭa, Iku haṣṭaduṣṭa harane, riṅ aṣṭaduṣṭa kaṁ tətəlu hado[1v3]ṣa pati, kaṁ lilima hadoṣa ha:rtha, katutūrəna deniṅ aR̥p··, vəruha patutūṅga{ha}/la\n§[SH]e, həndi ta kaṁ adoṣa patī,
    .@@X (ja1): [01v-02]riṁ ha:ṣṭa:dusta: varaha:kna . 0 . [01v-03]hamateni voṁ tan padoṣa, hakon· hamateni voṁ tan padoṣa:, [01v-04]haṅani voṁ tan padoṣa:, hakәmbulan paṅan lava ḍusta:, sapadulura [01v-05]n pan parane duṣṭa:, veḥ gnaḥhiṁ dusta:, hatuluṁ duṣṭa:, hiku hasta:du- [01v-06]ṣṭa:, harane, riṁ haṣṭa:duṣṭa:, kaṅ atətәlu kaṁṅ adoṣa pati, kaṁṅ ali- [01v-07]lima hadoṣa: hartha:, katutuR̥na deniṁ haR̥p· vəruha, riṁ patuṅga:- [01v-08]l-tuṅgalane, həndi kaṁ dosa pati,
    .@@J (edJ): riṅ aṣṭaduṣṭa varahakəna. amateni voṅ tan padoṣa, akon amatenana voṅ tan padoṣa, aṅanini voṅ tan padoṣa, akəmbulan paṅan lāvan duṣṭa, sapaduluran saparane lāvan duṣṭa, amitra lāvan duṣṭa, aveh gənah riṅ duṣṭa, atuluṅ duṣṭa, iku aṣṭaduṣṭa arane. riṅ aṣṭaduṣṭa kaṅ tətəlu adoṣa pati, kaṅ lilima adoṣa artha katuturəna deniṅ harəp vəruha patutuṅgalane, əndi ta kaṅ adoṣa pati?
    .@@H (edH): riṅ aṣṭa duṣṭa varahakəna. amateni voṅ tan padoṣa. akon amatenana voṅ tan padoṣa. aṅanini voṅ tan padoṣa. akəmbulan paṅan lāvan duṣṭa. sapaduluran saparane lāvan duṣṭa. amamitra lāvan duṣṭa. aveh gənah riṅ duṣṭa. atuluṅ duṣṭa. iku aṣṭaduṣṭa arane. riṅ aṣṭaduṣṭa kaṅ tətəlu adoṣa pati, kaṅ lilima adoṣa artha, katuturəna deniṅ harəp vəruha patutuṅgalane. əndi ta kaṅ adoṣa pati.
    .-->
    635<!-- #le1 #le2 #le3 #lo1 #ma1 #ja1 #edj #edh -->
    .<p n="1">riṅ <app><lem wit="#le2 #le3 #lo1 #ma1 #ja1 #edj #edh">aṣṭaduṣṭa varahakəna</lem>
    .<rdg wit="#le1">aṣṭaduṣṭa maṅke varahakəna</rdg></app>.
    .<app><lem wit="#le1 #le2 #lo1 #ma1 #ja1 #edj #edh">amateni</lem><rdg wit="#le3">amatenin</rdg></app> voṅ tan padoṣa,
    .akon <app><lem wit="#le1 #le2 #lo1 #ma1 #edj #edh">amatenana</lem>
    640<rdg wit="#le3">amatenin</rdg>
    .<rdg wit="#ja1">amateni</rdg></app> voṅ tan padoṣa,
    .<app type="note"><lem>

    . </app>voṅ tan padoṣa,</lem>
    .<note>This sentence is represented twice in <ptr target="#le1"/>, an illegible gap intervening.</note>
    .</app>
    .<app><lem wit="#le3 #lo1 #ma1 #edj #edh">akəmbulan paṅan lavan</lem>
    650<rdg wit="#le1">akbulan paṅan lavan</rdg>

    675riṅ aṣṭaduṣṭa <app><lem wit="#le1 #le2 #le3 #lo1 #ma1 #edj #edh">kaṅ tətəlu adoṣa</lem>

    680<rdg wit="#le3">patuṅgal-tuṅgalane</rdg>

    685<!--
    .@@A (le1): riṁ voṁṅ amateni voṁ tan padosa:, doṣa [1r4] pati,, riṁṅ akonana A:mateni voṁ tan padoṣa, doṣa pati,, riṁ hanatoni voṁ [SH] tan padoṣa, doṣa pati,,
    .@@B (le2): riṁ voṁṅ ama- [01-08]teni tan padoṣa, doṣa pati. riṁṅ akon amatenana: voṁ [01-09]tan padoṣa, doṣa pati, riṁṅ anatoni voṁ tan padoṣa, [01-10]doṣa pati,
    .@@C (le3): riṁ voṁṅ amaten riṁ voṁ tan padośa:, dośa pati. [01-11]riṁ voṁṅ akon amatenin voṁ tan padośa pati. [01-12]riṁ voṁ hanatonin voṁ tan padośa:, dośa pati.
    .@@L (lo1): riṁ Aṣṭa:duṣṭa kaṁ tətlu hadoṣa patī, kaṁ lilima: hadoṣa hartha, katutuR̥na deniṁ haR̥p· vəruha: patutuṅgalane,, həndi ta: kaṅ ha:dośa patī,, 0,, riṁ voṁ hamatenī tan padośa, dośa pati,, riṁ hakon amatenana voṁ tan padośa, dośa pati,, riṁ hanatonī voṁ tan padośa, dośa pati ,, 0,,

    .@@A (le1): hənḍi ta kaṁ lilima hadoṣa harttha:,, sapaṅan lavan ḍuṣ[ṭ]a, (sapadulu)[1v1]ran saparane lavan ḍuṣṭa, ṣamitra lavan ḍuṣṭa, haveḥ gnaḥ riṁ duṣṭa, Atulu(ṁ)<f> duṣṭa,, Iku [SH] haṣṭaduṣṭa harane,, <app>Instead of aṣṭaduṣṭa arane, J has: ta</app> kaṅ lilima pada doṣanana harttha: maro(ṁ) lakṣa r(i) duṣṭa (satuṅgal-tuṅgal·) [deni][1v2]ra saṅ amava bhūmi,, yen uvūs enak ka:sapekṣ{e}an deniṁ sakṣi kaduṣṭane
    .@@B (le2): həndi ta kaṁ lilima hadoṣa Arṭa ,, 0 ,, sapa- [01-11]ṅan lavan ḍuṣṭa,, samitra lavan duṣṭa, sapadulura:n lavan duśṭa,, have- [01-12]ḥ gnaḥ riṁ ḍuṣṭa:,, hatuluṁ duṣṭa,, <subst><del rend="strikeout">ha</del><add place="inline">I</add></subst>ku ta kalilima paḍḍa hadoṣa [01-13]harṭa, nora vnaṁ doṣanana pati, denira saṁṅ amava bh<subst><del rend="corrected">u</del><add place="overstrike">ū</add></subst>mi ,, 0 ,, [01-14]Amateni tan padoṣa, hakon amatenana voṁ tanpa doṣa,, [01-15]hanatonana voṁ tan padoṣa:,, duṣṭa tətәlu Iku yen sa<subst><del rend="strikeout">maḍi</del><add place="above">ciḥ</add></subst>na [01-16]savyakti, katlu dənḍa: pati, harane katlu duṣṭa: hatoh av<del>v</del>ake,, [01-17]yen amaku huripəniṁ saṅ a:mava: bhūmi, katlu dənḍa:nən pataṁ lakṣa vi- [01-18]ji-vijinən iṁ duṣṭa: satuṅgal-satuṅgal·, kaIlaṅane doṣane,,

    715@@L (lo1): həndi ta: kaṁ lilima: hadośa: hartha,, śapaṅan lavan ḍuṣṭa:,, samitra: lavan ḍuṣṭa:,, śapaduluran lavan ḍuṣṭa:,, haveḥ gnaḥ riṁ ḍuṣṭa:,, hatuluṁ duṣṭa:,, Iku ta kalima: paḍa hadośa hartha,, nora vnaṁ dośanana pati denira saṅ hamava: bhūmi,, hamateni tan padośa:,, hakon amatenana voṁ tanpa dośa,, hanatoni voṁ tan padośa:,, duṣṭa: tətlu hiku, yen sayakṭi sacihna, katəlu ḍəṇḍa pati, harane katlu duṣṭa: hatoh avake,, yen amalaku huripəniṁ saṅ ha:mava: bhūmī, katlu ḍəṇḍanən pataṁ lakṣa vivijinənniṁ duṣṭa: satuṅgal-satuṅgal·, kahilaṅane dośane ,, 0,,
    .@@M (ma1): həndi ta kaṁ lilima hadoṣa hartha,, sapaṅan lavan duṣṭa, samitra§ [2r1] lavan duṣṭa, sapadulūra{la}/n la\van duṣṭa, Aveḥ gnah iṁ duṣṭa, hatulūṁ duṣṭa, {hi}/I\ku ta kalima pa{da}/ḍa\ hadoṣa hartha, nora vnaṁ doṣana\:/na patī denira saṅ amava bhūmī,, hama[2r2]teni /voṁ\ tan padoṣa, hakon amatenī voṁ tan padoṣa, hanatoni voṁ tan pado[SH]ṣa, duṣṭa tətəlu hika, yen sayaktī sacihna, kaṁtəlu dənda patī, harane katlu [2r3] duṣṭa hatoh avaṁke, yen amalaku huripən iṁ saṅ amava bhumī,, katlu ḍəṇḍanən pataṁ la[SH]kṣa, vivijīnən iṁ duṣṭa satūṅgaltuṅgal·, ka/hi\la{i}ṅane doṣane,,
    .@@X (ja1): həndi ta kaṁ lilima doṣa har [01v-11]ttha, sapaṅan lavan ḍuṣta:, sapaduluran parane ḍusta:, samitra lavan du- [01v-12]ṣṭa, haveḥ gnah iṁ duṣṭa: hatuluṁ duṣṭa:, hiku ta kalilima paḍa hado- [01v-13]ṣa harttha, nora vnaṁ yan doṣanana pata, denira saṅ amava bhumi. hamate- [01v-14]ni voṁ tan padoṣa:, ha(?)kon hamateni tanpa doṣa, hanatoni ta- [01v-15]n padoṣa n sacana sayakṭi, kaṁ tәtәlu daṇḍa: pati [01v-16]harane,.     .@@J (edJ): əndi ta kaṅ lilima adoṣa hartha, sapaṅan lāvan duṣṭa, samitra lāvan duṣṭa, sapaduluran saparane lāvan duṣṭa, aveh gənah riṅ duṣṭa, atuluṅ duṣṭa,| iku ta kaṅ lilima paḍa adoṣa artha, nora vənaṅ doṣanana pati denira saṅ amava bhumi. amateni voṅ tan padoṣa, akon amatenana voṅ tan padoṣa, anatoni voṅ tan padoṣa, duṣṭa tətəlu iku, yan sayəkti sacihna, katəlu ḍəṇḍa pati arane katlu duṣṭa atoh avake, yen amalaku huripən iṅ saṅ amava bhumi, katəlu ḍəṇḍanən pataṅ lakṣa vivijinən iṅ duṣṭa satuṅgalsatuṅgal kahilaṅane doṣane.
    .@@H (edH): əndi ta kaṅ lilima adoṣa hartha. sapaṅan lāvan duṣṭa. samitra lāvan duṣṭa. sapaduluran saparane lāvan duṣṭa. aveh gənah riṅ duṣṭa. atuluṅ duṣṭa. iku ta kaṅ lima paḍa adoṣa artha. nora vənaṅ doṣanana pati denira saṅ amava bhumi. amateni voṅ tan padoṣa. akon amatenana voṅ tan padoṣa. anatoni voṅ tan padoṣa. duṣṭa tətəlu iku, yen sayəkti sacihna, katəlu ḍəṇḍa pati, arane katlu duṣṭa atoh avake. yen amalaku huripən iṅ saṅ amava bhumi, katəlu ḍəṇḍanən pataṅ lakṣa vivijinən iṅ duṣṭa satuṅgal-satuṅgal, kahilaṅane doṣane.
    720-->

    .əndi ta kaṅ lilima <app><lem wit="#le1 #le2 #le3 #lo1 #ma1 #edj #edh">adoṣa</lem>
    .<rdg wit="#ja1">doṣa</rdg></app>

    .<rdg wit="#le3"><gap reason="omitted"/></rdg>
    .</app>,
    .<app>
    .<lem type="reformulated_elsewhere">
    730 <app>
    . <lem wit="#le2 #lo1 #ma1 #edj #edh">samitra</lem>
    . <rdg wit="#le3">hasamittha</rdg>
    .</app> lavan duṣṭa,
    .sapaduluran <app><lem wit="#le1 #le3 #edj #edh">saparane</lem>
    735<rdg wit="#le2"><gap reason="omitted"/></rdg></app><app><lem wit="#le1 #le3 #edj #edh">lavan</lem>
    .<rdg wit="#le3"><gap reason="omitted"/></rdg></app> duṣṭa,</lem>
    .<witDetail type="retained" wit="#le2 #le3 #lo1 #ma1 #edj #edh"/>
    .<rdg wit="#le1">sapaduluran saparane lavan duṣṭa, samitra lavan duṣṭa sapaduluran saparane lavan duṣṭa, samitra lavan duṣṭa</rdg>
    .<rdg wit="#ja1">sapaduluran parane duṣṭa, samitra lavan duṣṭa</rdg>
    740</app>
    .<!-- ja1 sapaduluran parane ḍusta:, samitra lavan du[01v-12]ṣṭa, -->
    .aveh gənah <app><lem wit="#le1 #le2 #le3 #lo1 #edj #edh">riṅ</lem>
    .<rdg wit="#ma1 #ja1">iṅ</rdg>
    .</app>
    745duṣṭa, atuluṅ duṣṭa, <app><lem wit="#le2 #le3 #lo1 #ma1 #ja1 #edj #edh">iku ta</lem>
    .<rdg wit="#le1">iku aṣṭaduṣṭa harane</rdg>
    .</app>
    .<app>
    . <lem wit="#le1 #edj">kaṅ lilima</lem>
    750 <rdg wit="#le2 #ja1">kalilima</rdg>
    . <rdg wit="#le3 #lo1 #ma1">kalima</rdg>
    . <rdg wit="#edh">kaṅ lima</rdg>
    . <note>None of the variant readings that appear in this segment affect the meaning, as all variants refer to the same idea of <q>all five as a whole</q>. According to OJED, <foreign>lima</foreign> has a variant form <foreign>lilima</foreign>; thus, the form <foreign>kalima</foreign>, which is also attested, is morphologically coherent with <foreign>kalilima</foreign>. The choice of <foreign>kaṅ lilima</foreign> in this edition is intended to maintain consistency with the form selected earlier at the beginning of this article, ensuring editorial coherence throughout.</note>
    .</app>
    755paḍa <app><lem wit="#le2 #le3 #lo1 #ma1 #ja1 #edj #edh">adoṣa</lem>
    .<rdg wit="#le1">doṣanana</rdg>
    .</app>
    .artha.
    .<app><lem wit="#le2 #le3 #lo1 #ma1 #edj #edh">nora vənaṅ doṣanana pati</lem>
    760<rdg wit="#ja1">nora vənaṅ yan doṣanana pata</rdg>
    .<rdg wit="#le1"><gap reason="omitted"/></rdg>
    .</app>
    .<app><lem wit="#le2 #le3 #lo1 #ma1 #ja1 #edj #edh">denira saṅ amava bhūmi.</lem>
    .<rdg wit="#le1"><gap reason="omitted"/></rdg>
    765</app>
    .<app><lem wit="#ma1 #ja1 #edj #edh">amateni voṅ tan padoṣa,</lem>
    .<rdg wit="#le1"><gap reason="omitted"/></rdg>
    .<rdg wit="#le2 #lo1">amateni tan padoṣa,</rdg>
    .<rdg wit="#le3" cause="dittography">amatenin voṅ tan padoṣa, amatenin voṅ tan padoṣa,</rdg>
    770</app>
    .<app><lem wit="#le2 #lo1 #edj #edh">akon amatenana voṅ tan padoṣa,</lem>
    .<rdg wit="#le1"><gap reason="omitted"/></rdg>
    .<rdg wit="#le3">akon amatenin voṁ tan padoṣa.</rdg>
    .<rdg wit="#ma1">akon amatenī voṁ tan padoṣa,</rdg>
    775<rdg wit="#ja1">akon amateni tan padoṣa,</rdg>
    .</app>
    .<app><lem wit="#lo1 #ma1 #edj #edh">anatoni voṅ tan padoṣa.</lem>
    .<rdg wit="#le1"><gap reason="omitted"/></rdg>

    810<app><lem wit="#lo1 #ma1 #edj #edh">katəlu ḍəṇḍanən pataṅ lakṣa vivijinən iṅ duṣṭa satuṅgal-satuṅgal kahilaṅane doṣane.</lem>
    .<rdg wit="#le1"><gap reason="omitted"/></rdg>
    .<rdg wit="#le2">katəlu ḍəṇḍanən pataṅ lakṣa viji-vijinən iṅ duṣṭa satuṅgal-satuṅgal kahilaṅane doṣane.</rdg>
    .<rdg wit="#le3">katәlu ḍaṇḍanən voluṁ lakṣa, vivijinən iṅ ḍuṣṭa satuṅgal-satuṅgal, kahilaṅaniṅ doṣane.</rdg>
    .<rdg wit="#ja1">katәlu ḍaṇḍanən, voluṁ lakṣa viji-vijinən riṅ satuṅgal-satuṅgal, kahilaṅane.</rdg>
    815</app>

    .@@A (le1): ... maro(ṁ) lakṣa r(i) duṣṭa (satuṅgal-tuṅgal·) [deni][1v2]ra saṅ amava bhūmi,, yen uvūs enak ka:sapekṣ{e}an deniṁ sakṣi kaduṣṭane
    .@@B (le2): Ana ḍene kaṁ sapaṅan lavan duṣṭa:, sadulur lavan du- [01-20]ṣṭa:, samitra lavan duṣṭa:, Aveḥ gnaḥ riṁ duṣṭa:, hatulūṁ duṣṭa,, I- [01-21]ku <subst><del rend="strikeout">ha</del><add place="above">ta</add></subst> [01-22]kalima dəṇḍanən·, paḍa deni(na)ra saṅ a:mava bhūmi,, ha- [01-23]roṁ lakṣa riṁ voṁ duṣṭa sa:tuṅgal-satuṅgal·, yen vuvus e<del>?</del>na- [01-24]<margin hand="roman">2</margin>k kaṣapekṣan deniṁ sakṣi kaḍuṣṭane ,, 0,,
    820@@C (le3): hana dene sapaṅan la:van ḍuṣṭa:, sapaduluran sa- [01-25]parane lavan ḍuṣṭa:, samittha lavan ḍuṣṭa:, IMG_0078 <pb n="2"/><fw n="2" place="top"><num value="2">2</num></fw> [02-01]hatuluṁ ḍuṣṭa, haveḥ gnaḥ riṁ ḍuṣṭa:. hiku ta kalima: paḍa ḍəṇḍanən deni- [02-02]ra saṁṅ amava bhūmi, Aroṁ lakṣa riṁ voṁ ḍuṣṭa satuṅgal-satuṅgal·, yen uvus e- [02-03]nakasapekṣan deniṁ sakṣi kaḍuṣṭa:ne , 0 ,
    .@@L (lo1): hana dene kaṁ sapaṅan lavan ḍuṣṭa:,, sadulur lavan ḍuṣṭa:,, hamitra: lavan ḍuṣṭa:,, hatuluṁ duṣṭa:,, haveḥ gnaḥ riṁ duṣṭa:,, Iku ta kalima: paḍḍa ḍəṇḍanən· denira saṅ ha:mava: bhūmi, Aṁroṁ lakṣa: riṁ voṁ duṣṭa: satuṅgal-satuṅgal·, yen vuvus enak kasapekṣan deniṁ sa:kṣi kaduṣṭa:ne
    .@@M (ma1): hana dene [2r4] /kaṁ\ sa{va}/pa\ṅan la:va duṣṭa, sadulūr lavan duṣṭa, samitra lavan duṣṭa, haveḥ gnah iṁ duṣṭa, Atuluṁ [SH] duṣṭa, hiku ta kalima ḍəṇḍanən· pada denira saṅ amava bhumī, Aṁroṁ lakṣa [2v1] riṁ voṁ duṣṭa satuṅgalsatuṅgal·, yen uvus enak kasāpekṣan deniṁ sakṣi kaduṣṭane,, 0 [SH] ,,
    .@@X (ja1): na ne sapaṅan lavan duṣṭa:, sapaduluran la- [01v-20]van duṣta:, samitra lavan duṣṭa, hatuluṁ duṣṭa, haveḥ gnaḥ riṁ duṣṭa:, hiku [01v-21]ta: kalima pa:ḍa daṇḍanən denira saṅ a:mava bhumi, haroṁ lakṣa riṁ voṁ [01v-22]dusta satuṅgal-satuṅgal·, yen vus enak kasapekṣan deniṁ sakṣa kadu- [01v-23]ṣta:ne ,, 0 ,,
    .@@J (edJ): hana dene kaṅ sapaṅan lāvan duṣṭa, sadulur lāvan duṣṭa, amitra lāvan duṣṭa, aveh gənah riṅ duṣṭa, iku kalima paḍa ḍəṇḍanən aṅroṅ lakṣa denira saṅ amava bhumi, yen huvus enak kasāpekṣan deniṅ sākṣi kaduṣṭane.
    825@@H (edH): ana dene kaṅ sapaṅan lāvan duṣṭa. sadulur lāvan duṣṭa. amitra lāvan duṣṭa. atuluṅ duṣṭa. aveh gənah riṅ duṣṭa. iku kalima paḍa ḍəṇḍanən, denira saṅ amava bhumi, aṅroṅ lakṣa riṅ voṅ duṣṭa satuṅgal-satuṅgal, yen vuvus enak kasāpekṣan deniṅ sākṣi kaduṣṭane.
    .-->

    .yen huvus enak kasāpekṣān deniṅ <app><lem wit="#le1 #le2 #le3 #lo1 #ma1 #edj #edh">sākṣi</lem><rdg wit="#ja1">sakṣa</rdg></app>kaduṣṭane.

    .<!--
    .@@A (le1):
    870@@B (le2):
    .@@C (le3):
    .@@L (lo1):
    .@@M (ma1):
    .@@X (ja1):
    875@@J (edJ):
    .@@H (edH):
    .
    .A (le1): maniḥ §[SH] yen ha:na voṁ halavas amitra lavan ḍuṣṭa,, haṅiṁ nora vəruḥ yen ḍuṣṭa, dene dohe humahe §[1v3] desane, kaṅ amitra hiṅ iya, kadənḍaha pataṁ tali təluṅ atak denira saṅ amava bhūmi,, sa[SH]ṅkane kadənda, dene halavas apamitra tur anəṅguḥ tan vəruh iṅ iya yen duṣṭa ,, 0 ,, yen ta:n ala[1v4]vas dene hamitra, tuhu-tuhu tan vəruḥ iṅ iya, yen duṣṭa, tan kaḍəṇḍaha{n} denira saṅ a:[SH]mava bhūmi, Apan den tan alavas dene hamitra, tur duruṁ vəruḥ yen duṣṭa, maṅkana raṣa saṁ hyaṁṅ agama, [2r1] , 0 ,,
    .B (le2): maniḥ yen hana [01-25]voṁ hala:vas a:pamitra lavan duṣṭa, haṅiṁ nora vəruḥ yen ḍuṣṭa, ⌈ [01-26]dene dohe humahe, dohe deśane, kaṅ amitra riṁṅ i- [01-27]ya, kaḍəṇḍaha pataṁ talī tluṅ ata<del>tus</del>k denira saṅ a<del>?</del>dr̥ve bhū- [01-28]mī, saṅkane kaḍəṇḍa:, dene halavas apamitra tur anəṅguḥ tan və- ruh iṁṅ iya yen ḍuṣṭa:,, 0,
    880C (le3): maniḥ <add place="above" rend="mark">yen ana</add> voṁ halavas apami- [02-04]ttha lavan ḍuṣṭa:, hana nora vruḥ yen ḍuṣṭa:, dene dohe humahe, [02-05]dene dohe deśane, kaṅ amittha ṅ riṅ iya, kaḍəṇḍa:ha mataṁ tali tluṅ [02-06]ṅatak· denira saṅ amava bhūmi, saṅkane kaḍəṇḍa:, dene halavas apa- [02-06]mittha tur anəṅguḥ tan vəruh iṅ i ya yen ḍuṣṭa: .
    .L (lo1): maniḥ yen ana: voṁ halavas hapamitra: lava- [5v2]n ḍuṣṭa:, haṅhiṁ nora: vəruḥ yen ḍuṣṭa, dene dohe humahe, dohe deśane, kaṅ amitra hiṅ hiya:, kadəṇḍaha pataṁ talī tluṅ ata- [5v3]k denira saṅ amava: bhūmī,, saṅkane kaḍəṇḍa:, dene halavas hamitra:, tur anəṅguḥ tan vəruh iṁṅ iya yen ḍuṣṭa:,, 0,, yen tan alavas ḍe- [5v4]ne hamitra:, tuhu-tuhu tan vəruḥh iṁṅ iya yen ḍuṣṭa:,, tan kaḍəṇḍaha: denira: saṅ ha:mava bhūmī, hapan tan alavas dene hamitra:, tur duruṁ vəruḥ yen ḍuṣṭa:,, maṅkaṇa: raṣa: saṁ hyaṁ hagama || 0 ||
    .M (ma1): maniḥ yen hana voṁ halavas amitra lavan duṣṭa, haṅiṁ nora v[əruḥ yen] du[2v2]ṣṭa, dene dohe vumahe, dohe desane, kaṅ amitra hiṅ iya, kaḍəṇḍaha pa[SH]taṁ tali tluṅ atak denira saṅ a{dr̥}/ma\va{e} bhumī, saṅkane kaḍəṇḍa, dene halava[2v3]s apamitra tūr anəṅguḥ tan veruḥ hiṅ iya yen dusṭa,, yen tan alava{capa}/(p)dene h\amitra, tuhu-tuhu ta[SH]n vəruḥ riṅ iya yen duṣṭa, tan kaḍəṇḍaha denira saṅ a{dr̥}/ma\va{e} bhumī, hapan tan ala[2v4]vas /(*)e\/ne ha\mitra, tūr duruṁ vəruḥ yen duṣṭa, maṅkana rasa sa:ṁ hyaṁ hagama,, 0 ,,
    .X (ja1): maniḥ yen ana vo halavas· hamitra lavan duṣṭa:, naṅiṁ nora vəruḥ yen du- [01r-01]ṣṭa, dene doḥhe humahe deṣane, kaṅ amitra riṁṅ iya, kadaṇḍa- [01r-02]ha pataṁ tali tluṁṅ a:tak·, denira saṅ a:mava bhumi, saṅkane ḍaṇḍa [01r-03]ne, vruḥ riṁṅ i yan duṣta: ,, 0 ,, [01r-04]yen tan a:lavas· dene hamitra, tuhu-tu tatan arapiṁṅ iya yen du- [01r-05]ṣṭa:, tan kaḍiṇda ta denira saṅ amava bhumi, hapan tan alavas dene ha- [01r-06]mitra:, tur duruṁ vəruḥ yen duṣṭa: maṅkaṇa rasa saṁ hyaṁ hagama ,, 0 ,,
    .J (edJ): manih yen hana voṅ alavas amitra lāvan duṣṭa, aṅiṅ nora vəruh yen duṣṭa, dene dohe umahe, dohe deśane, kaṅ amitra iṅ iya kaḍəṇḍaha pataṅ tali təluṅ atak denira saṅ amava bhumi, saṅkane kaḍəṇḍa dene alavas amitra tur anəṅguh tan vəruh iṅ iya yen duṣṭa.
    885yen tan alavas dene amitra, tuhutuhu tan vəruh iṅ iya, yen duṣṭa, tan kaḍəṇḍaha denira saṅ amava bhumi, apan tan alavas dene amitra, tur duruṅ vəruh yen duṣṭa. maṅkana rasa saṅ hyaṅ āgama.
    .H (edH): manih yen hana voṅ alavas apamitra lāvan duṣṭa, aṅiṅ nora vəruh yen duṣṭa, dene dohe umahe, dohe deśane, kaṅ amitra iṅ iya, kaḍəṇḍaha pataṅ tali təluṅ atak denira saṅ amava bhumi. saṅkane kaḍəṇḍa, dene alavas pamitra, tur anəṅguh tan vəruh iṅ iya yen duṣṭa.
    .yen tan alavas dene amitra, tuhu-tuhu tan vəruh iṅ iya, yen duṣṭa. tan kaḍəṇḍaha denira saṅ amava bhumi, apan tan alavas dene amitra, tur duruṅ vəruh yen duṣṭa. maṅkana rasa saṅ hyaṅ āgama.
    .-->

    .denira saṅ amava bhūmi,
    960<app>
    .<lem wit="#le2 #lo1 #ma1 #ja1 #edj #edh">apan tan alavas dene amitra</lem>
    .<rdg wit="#le3">apa tan alavas dene apamittha</rdg>
    .<rdg wit="#le1">apan den tan alavas dene amitra</rdg>
    .</app>
    965, <app><lem wit="#le1 #lo1 #ma1 #ja1 #edj #edh">tur duruṅ vəruh yen duṣṭa</lem>
    .<rdg wit="#le2">tur vəruh yen duṣṭa</rdg>
    .<rdg wit="#le3">tur duruṅ vәruh yen ya ḍuṣṭa</rdg>
    .</app>, maṅkana rasa saṅ hyaṅ āgama.
    .</p>
    970<!--
    .A (le1): hana kavula vadon miṅgat sakiṁ gustine, iṅiṅgatakən deniṁ voṁ len·, katmu den[SH]e gustine, kaṅ aṅiṅgatakən·, kaḍəṇḍaha pataṁ lakṣa denira saṅ amava bhūmi,, hana dene huta[2r2]ṅe voṁ vadon ka:ṅ iṅiṅgatakən ika:, mulihanikəl saguṅ iṁ hutaṁ, mariṁ gustine voṁ va[SH]don ika:, tur palakonana pavadal gave, salavase miṅgat sakiṁ gustine, Apan maliṁṅ ara[2r3]n iṁ voṅ aṅiṅgatakən kavulaniṁ voṁ ,, 0 ,,
    .B (le2): hana kavula vadon miṅgat sakiṅ gustine, hiṅiṁṅgatakə- [02-05]n deniṁ voṁ len·, katmu dene gusṭine, kaṅ a:ṅiṅgatakən kaḍəṇḍaha [02-06]pataṁ lakṣa denira saṅ a:mava bhūmi, hana dene hutaṅe voṁ va- [02-07]don kaṅ iṅiṅgatakn ika:, muliha hanikəl saguṅiṁ hutaṁ, mariṁ gusṭi ⌈ [02-08]ne voṁ vadon ika, tūr palakonana pa<add place="above">va</add>ḍal gave salavase miṅga- [02-09]t sakiṁ guṣṭi, Apan maliṅ araniṁ voṁ haṅiṅgatakən kavulaniṁ voṁ ,, 0 ,,
    .C (le3): hana kavula va- ⌈ [47-08]don·, miṅgat sakiṁ gustine, hiṅiṅgatakən deniṁ voṁ len·, [47-09]katmu dene gustine, kaṅ aṅiṅgatakən kaḍəṇḍaha pataṁ la- [47-10]kṣa denira saṁṅ amava bhūm<subst><del rend="corrected">a:</del><add place="above">i</add></subst>, hana dene hutaṅe voṁ va- [47-11]don kaṁ hiṅiṅgatakəna ka: mulihanikəl saguṅiṁṅ utaṁ, ma- [47-12]riṁ gustine voṁ vadon ika:, tūr phalakokәnana pavaḍal ga- [47-13]ve salavase miṅgat sakiṁ gustine, Apan maliṁ haraniṁ voṁ [47-14]haṅiṅgatakən kavulaniṁ voṁ ,, 0 ,,
    .L (lo1): hana kavula: va:don miṅgat sakiṁ gustine, hiṅiṅgatakən deniṁ voṁ len·, [6r2]katmū dene gustine, kaṅ ha:ṅiṅgatakən kaḍəṇḍaha: pataṁ lakṣa: denira: saṅ ha:mava bhūmī, hana dene hutaṅe voṁ vadon kaṅ hiṅiṅga- [6r3]takən ika:, muliha: hanikəl saguṅiṁ hutaṁ, tūr palakonana pavaḍal gave śalavaśe miṅgat sakiṁ gusti, hapan maliṁ ṅaraniṁ voṁ haṅi- [6r4]ṅgata:kən· kavulaniṁ voṁ
    975M (ma1): hana kavula va[SH]don miṅgat sakiṁ guṣṭine, hiṅiṅgata:kən deniṁ voṁ len·, katəmu de§[3r1]ne guṣṭine, kaṅ aṅiṅga:takən kaḍəṇḍaha pataṁ lakṣa denira saṅ amava bhumī, hana de[SH]ne hutaṅe voṁ vadon kaṅ iṅiṅgatakn ika:, mulihanikəl saguṅ i{ṅū}/hu\taṁ, ma§[3r2]riṁ guṣṭine voṁ vadon ika, tūr palakonana pavaḍalgave salavaṣe miṅga{ca}t sakiṁ [SH] guṣṭine, hapan maliṁ haran iṁ voṁ haṅiṅgatakən kahulaniṁ voṁ,, 0 ,,
    .X (ja1): hana kavula vadon· miṅgat sakiṁ gustine, siṁ gavene hiṅupa- [01r-08]han gavene deniṁ len·, naṅkən oliḥ hupahan· gustine ha-⌈ [01r-09]met·, vkasan mati kavula hika, pinaten deniṁ duṣṭa:, yen ḍuruṁ ha- ⌈ [01r-10]veh upahan·, kaṅ aṅupah-upaḥ, haveha hupahan·, riṁ kaṅ aduve ka- [01r-11]vula:, deniṁ patine kahulane, tan· vnaṁ kaṅ aṅupah-upa yan vi- [01r-12]ca:ranən· ,, 0 ,,
    .J (edJ): hana kavula vadon miṅgat sakiṅ gustine, iṅiṅgatakən deniṅ voṅ len, katəmu dene gustine, kaṅ aṅiṅgatakən kaḍəṇḍaha pataṅ lakṣa denira saṅ amava bhumi. hana dene hutaṅe voṅ vadon kaṅ iṅiṅgatakən ikā, mulihanikəl saguṅ iṅ hutaṅ mariṅ gustine voṅ vadon ikā, tur palakonana pavadal-gave, salavase miṅgat sakiṅ gustine, apan maliṅ araniṅ voṅ aṅiṅgatakən kavulaniṅ voṅ.
    .H (edH): hana kavula vadon miṅgat sakiṅ gustine, iṅiṅgatakən deniṅ voṅ len, katəmu dene gustine, kaṅ aṅiṅgatakən kaḍəṇḍaha pataṅ lakṣa denira saṅ amava bhumi, hana dene hutaṅe voṅ vadon kaṅ iṅiṅgatakən ikā, mulihanikəl saguṅ iṅ hutaṅ, tur palakonana pavadal-gave salavase miṅgat sakiṅ gustine, apan maliṅ araniṅ voṅ aṅiṅgatakən kavulaniṅ voṅ.
    .-->
    980<!-- #le1 #le2 #le3 #lo1 #ma1 #ja1 #edj #edh -->
    .<p n="3">
    .hana kavula vadon miṅgat sakiṅ gustine,
    .<app><lem wit="#le1 #le2 #le3 #lo1 #ma1 #edj #edh">iṅiṅgatakən deniṅ voṅ len, katəmu dene gustine, kaṅ aṅiṅgatakən kaḍəṇḍaha pataṅ lakṣa denira saṅ amava bhūmi. anadene hutaṅe voṅ vadon kaṅ iṅiṅgatakən
    . <app><lem wit="#le1 #le2 #lo1 #ma1 #edj #edh">ikā,</lem>
    985 <rdg wit="#le3">akā</rdg>
    . </app>
    . <app><lem wit="#le1 #le3 #ma1 #edj #edh">mulih anikəl</lem>
    . <rdg wit="#le2 #lo1">muliha anikəl</rdg>
    . </app> saguṅiṅ hutaṅ
    990 <app><lem wit="#le1 #le2 #le3 #ma1 #edj">mariṅ gustine voṅ vadon ikā</lem>
    . <rdg wit="#lo1 #edh"><gap reason="omitted"/></rdg>
    . </app>, tur <app><lem wit="#le1 #le2 #lo1 #ma1 #edj #edh">palakonana</lem>
    . <rdg wit="#le3">palakokәnana</rdg>
    . </app> pavadal-gave salavase miṅgat sakiṅ <app><lem wit="#le1 #le3 #lo1 #ma1 #edj #edh">gustine</lem>
    995 <rdg wit="#le2">gusti</rdg>
    . </app>, apan maliṅ araniṅ voṅ aṅiṅgatakən kavulaniṅ voṅ.</lem>

    .</app></p>
    .<!--
    1000A (le1): hana kavulaniṁ voṁ den-kon ameta gav[SH]e {n}dene gustine, siṅ sagavene, hiṅupahan gavene deniṁṅ len·, naṅkən olih upahən gu[2r4]stine hamet·, vəkasan mati kavula hika:, pinaten deniṁ duṣṭa, yen ḍuruṅ aveḥ [SH] hupahan kaṅ aṅupah-upaḥ, A:veha hupahan iṅ kaṅ aduve kavula, deniṁ patine kavulane [2v1] , tan· vnaṁ kaṅ aṅupah-upaḥ yan vicaranən· ,, 0 ,,
    .B (le2): hana kavulaniṁ voṁ den kon amameta: gavene deniṁ gustine, [02-11]siṁ sakagavene, hiṅupahan gavene deniṁ len·, naṅkən olih u- [02-12]pahan gustine hamet·, vkasan ma:ti kavula hika:, pinaten de- [02-13]niṁ ḍuṣṭa:, yen ḍuruṅ aveh upahan kaṅ aṅupah-upaḥ, Aveha hupaha- [02-14]n iṅ kaṅ aduve kavula deniṁ patine kavulane, tan· vnaṁ kaṅ aṅupaḥ [02-15]<margin hand="roman">5</margin>yan vicaranən· ,, 0 ,,
    .C (le3): hana kavulaniṁ voṁ de- [05-11]n kon ameta gavene gustine, hiṅupahan gavene deniṁṅ len·, [05-12]naṅkə:n olih upahan gustine hamet·, vkasan mati kavula hika:, pina- [05-13]ten deniṁ ḍuṣṭa:, yen ḍuruṅ aveh upahan kaṅ aṅupah-upaḥ, Aveha hupaha- [05-14]n iṁ kaṅ aduve kavula:, dene patine kavulane hika:<add place="above">,</add> tan· vnaṁ kaṅ a- [05-15]<margin hand="roman">*</margin>ṅupah-upaḥ yan vicaranən· ,, 0 ,,
    .L (lo1): hana kavulaniṁ voṁ den kona:meta: gavene gustine, Asiṁ sagavehane, hiṅupa§- [margin-left-1: 6] [margin-left-2: , hapəpgata(n)·] [margin-left-3: halaki, ] [margin-left-4: {haṅrusak titipa-}] [margin-left-5: n·, ] [margin-right-roman-1: 6] [6v1]han gavene deniṁ len·, na:ṅkən holiḥ hupahan gustine hamet·, vkasan matī kavula hika:, pinaten deniṁ duṣṭa:, yen ḍuruṁ haveḥ hu- [6v2]pahan· kaṅ ha:ṅupah-upaḥ, Aveha: hupahan iṁ kaṅ ha:duve kavula:, deniṁ patine kahulane, tan vənaṁ kaṅ ha:ṅupaḥ-hupaḥ yan vicaranən·
    .M (ma1): hana kahu§[3r3]laniṁ voṁ den-kon ameta gave dene gustine, siṁ sa{ka}gavehane, hiṅūpahan ga[SH]vene deniṁ len·, naṅkən olih upaḥ tan guṣṭine hamet·, vkasan mati ka§[3r4]vula hīka, pinaten deniṁ duṣṭa, yen duruṅ aveh upaḥ{ka}/tan ka\ kaṅ aṅupahupaḥ, Aveha hupa[SH]han iṅ adr̥ve kavula, deniṁ patine kavulane, tan vənaṁ kaṅ aṅupahu[3v1]maḥ yan vicaranən·,, 0 ,,
    1005X (ja1): …naṅkən oliḥ hupahan· gustine ha-⌈ [01r-09]met·, vkasan mati kavula hika, pinaten deniṁ duṣṭa:, yen ḍuruṁ ha- ⌈ [01r-10]veh upahan·, kaṅ aṅupah-upaḥ, haveha hupahan·, riṁ kaṅ aduve ka- [01r-11]vula:, deniṁ patine kahulane, tan· vnaṁ kaṅ aṅupah-upa yan vi- [01r-12]ca:ranən· ,, 0 ,,
    .J (edJ): hana kavulaniṅ voṅ den-kon ameta gave dene gustine, siṅ sagavehane iṅupahan gavene deniṅ len, naṅkən olih upahan gustine amet, mati kavula ikā pinaten deniṅ duṣṭa, yen duruṅ aveh upahan kaṅ aṅupahupah aveha upahan iṅ kaṅ adr̥ve kavula, deniṅ patine kavulane, tan vənaṅ kaṅ aṅupahupah, yan vicaranən.
    .H (edH): hana kavulaniṅ voṅ den-kon ameta gave dene gustine, asiṅ sagavehane, iṅupahan gavene deniṅ len, naṅkən olih upahan gustine amet, vkasan mati kavula ikā, pinaten deniṅ duṣṭa, yen duruṅ aveh upahan kaṅ aṅupah-upah, aveha upahan iṅ kaṅ adr̥ve kavula, deniṅ patine kavulane, tan vənaṅ kaṅ aṅupah-upahyan vicaranan.
    .-->

    1050<!--
    .@@A (le1): Ana voṅ apəpəgatan alaki-harabi, papa§t· [SH] yakt(i)<f>niṁṅ apəpəgatan sacihnane,, sakṣi, haṅgəmpal pisisadulur ūjar i(ṁ) laki, haveḥ (bañ)u ra(h)up· [2v2] , haveḥ vija bras·, Iku ta L̥viḥ pinakacihna yaktiniṅ apəpəgatan·, sidḍa hatadin hara[SH]ne, yenora yaktine papat iku, dudu tadin harane, duruṁ pəgat uga palaki-rabine, hana: po [2v3] voṁ vadon maṅka:na, tan pacihna hapəpəgatan·, tumuli halaki riṅ len·, kaṅ haṅalap· [SH] ḍəṇḍanən pataṁ lakṣa de saṁ hamava bhūmi ,, 0 ,,
    .@@B (le2): hana voṁṅ apəpəgatan alaki harabi, [02-16]papat· yaktiniṁṅ apəpәgatan·, ci<add place="above">ḥ</add>ṇnane, sakṣi, haṅgəmpal pi- [02-17]sis a:ḍulūrran jar iṁ laki, haveḥ bañu rahup·, haveḥ vija bras· [02-18]hiku ta L̥viḥ pinakacihna-yaktin<subst><del rend="corrected">ә</del><add place="overstrike">i</add></subst>ṅ apəpәg<del>ta</del>a<add place="above">ta</add>n·, sidda hatadi- [02-19]n harane, yen ora na yaktine papat iku, dudu tadin ha:rane, [02-20]duruṁ pgat uga paphaki-rabine,, hapan voṁ vadon maṅkana haci<add place="above">ḥ</add>ṇna ha- [02-21]pəpgatan·, tumuli halaki ri len·, kaṅ haṅalap ḍəṇḍanən pataṁ la- [02-22]<margin hand="roman">6</margin>kṣa de saṁ hamava bhūmi ,, 0 ,,
    .@@C (le3): [24-12]hana voṁṅ apəpəgatan alaki harabi, papat· yakti- ⌈ [24-13]ne riṁṅ apəpәgatan·, cihnane. saksi, haṅgəmpal pisi- [24-14]s·, hadulur hujariṁ laki, haveḥ bañu rahup·, ha- ⌈ [24-15]veḥ vija bras·, hika ta L̥viḥ <subst><del rend="corrected">m</del><add place="overstrike">p</add></subst>inakacihna-yaktiniṁṅ a- [24-16]pəpәgatan·, sidḍa hatadin harane,, yen ora ṇa yakṭi- [24-17]ne papat iku, dudu tadin iku harane, duruṁ pgat uga pha- [24-18]laki-rabine,, hana po voṁ vadon maṅkana:, tan paci- [24-19]hna hapəpgatan·, tumuli halaki len·, kaṅ haṅa- [24-20]lap· ḍəṇḍanən pataṁ lakṣa denira saṁṅ amava bhūmi ,, 0 ,,
    .@@L (lo1): hana voṁ hapəpəgatan alakī harabi, papat· yaktiniṁ hapəpga:tan·, cihnane, sakṣī, haṅgəṅgəmpal pisis hadulur hujar riṁ laki, haveḥ bañu ra- [6v4]vup·, haveḥ vija bras· Iku ta: L̥viḥ pinaka:cihna-yaktīniṁ hapəpgatan·, śiḍa: hatadin harane,, yen ora na: yakṭine papat iku, dudu tadin harane, duruṁ pgat uga phalaki-rabine,, hana po voṁ vadon maṅkaṇa:, tan pacihna hapəpgatan·, tumuli halaki riṁ len·, kaṅ ha:ṅalap· ḍəṇḍanən pataṁ [7r2]lakṣa: de saṅ amava bhūmī
    1055@@M (ma1): hana voṁ apəpəgatan alakiharabī, papat· yaktiniṅ apepega[SH]tan·, cihnane, sakṣi, haṅgəmpal pisis adulur ujar iṁ lakī, haveḥ bañu ra[3v2]hup·, haveḥ vija bras·, hiku ta L̥viḥ pinakacihna yaktīniṅ apəpəgatan·, sidḍa ha[SH]tadin harane, yenorana yaktīne papat īka, dudu tadin harane, dūrūṁ pə[3v3]gat uga palakirabine,, hana po voṁ vadon maṅkana, tan pacihna hapəpəgatan·, tumuli [SH] halaki riṁ len·, kaṅ aṅhalap· ḍəṇḍanen pataṁ lakṣa denira saṁ a:mava bumī [3v4],, 0 ,,
    .@@X (ja1): hana voṁ hapəpətan alaki harabi, papat· yaktiniṁ hapəpgatan·, ci- [01r-14]ṇane sakṣi haṅgəmpalakәn pisis adurr ujariṁ laki, haveḥ bañu ra- [01r-15]vup·, haveḥ hvija: bras· hiku ta L̥viḥ pinakaṁ cina-yaktiniṁ [01r-16]hapəpәgatan·, sida hatadin· harane, yen ora na yakti [01r-17]papat iku, ḍuḍu tadin· harane, duruṁ pgat uga malaki-rabi- ⌈ [01r-18]ne tani ,, 0 ,, [01r-19]hana po voṁ vadon· maṅkaṇa: tan pacina hapəpәtan·, tu- [01r-20]muli halaki riṁ len·, kaṅ a:ṅalap·, ḍəṇḍanən pataṁ lakṣa deni- [01r-21]ra saṅ amava bhūmi ,, 0 ,,
    .@@J (edJ): hana voṅ apəpəgatan alakiarabi, papat yaktiniṅ pəpəgatan, cihnane: sākṣi, aṅgəmpal pisis sadulur ujariṅ laki, aveh bañu rahup, aveh vija bras, iku ta ləvih pinakacihna yaktiniṅ apəpəgatan. siddha atadin arane, yen nora hana yaktine papat iku, dudu tadin arane, duruṅ pəgat uga palakirabine, hana po voṅ vadon maṅkana, tan pacihna apəpəgatan, tumuli alaki riṅ len, kaṅ aṅalap, ḍəṇḍanən pataṅ lakṣa de saṅ amava bhumi.
    .@@H (edH): hana voṅ apəpəgatan alaki-arabi, papat yaktiniṅ apəpəgatan, cihnane, sākṣi, aṅgəmpal pisis sadulur ujariṅ laki, aveh bañu rahup, aveh vija bras, iku ta ləvih pinakacihna yaktiniṅ apəpəgatan, siddha atadin arane, yen nora hana yaktine papat iku, dudu tadin arane, duruṅ pəgat uga palaki-rabine, hana po voṅ vadon maṅkana, tan pacihna apəpəgatan, tumuli alaki riṅ len, kaṅ aṅalap ḍəṇḍanən pataṅ lakṣa de saṅ amava bhumi.
    .-->

    .A (le1): kaṅ haṅalap· [SH] ḍəṇḍanən pataṁ lakṣa de saṁ hamava bhūmi ,, 0 ,,

    .C (le3): kaṅ haṅa- [24-20]lap· ḍəṇḍanən pataṁ lakṣa denira saṁṅ amava bhūmi ,, 0 ,,
    .

    .J (edJ): kaṅ aṅalap, ḍəṇḍanən pataṅ lakṣa de saṅ amava bhumi.
    1075
    .H (edH): kaṅ aṅalap ḍəṇḍanən pataṅ lakṣa de saṅ amava bhumi.
    .-->
    .<!-- #le1 #le2 #le3 #lo1 #ma1 #ja1 #edj #edh -->
    .<p n="5">hana voṅ
